13.Talal Itani (2012): And whatsoever He created for you on earth is of diverse colors. Surely in that is a sign for people who are mindful

14.Talal Itani (2012): And it is He who made the sea to serve you, that you may eat from it tender meat, and extract from it ornaments that you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, as you seek His bounties, so that you may give thanks

15.Talal Itani (2012): And he cast mountains on the earth, lest it shifts with you; and rivers, and roads, so that you may be guided

16.Talal Itani (2012): And landmarks. And by the stars they guide themselves

17.Talal Itani (2012): Is He who creates like him who does not create? Will you not take a lesson

18.Talal Itani (2012): And if you tried to enumerate the favors of God, you will not be able to count them. God is Forgiving and Merciful

19.Talal Itani (2012): And God knows what you hide and what you disclose

20.Talal Itani (2012): Those they invoke besides God create nothing, but are themselves created

21.Talal Itani (2012): They are dead, not alive; and they do not know when they will be resurrected

22.Talal Itani (2012): Your God is one God. As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, their hearts are in denial, and they are arrogant

23.Talal Itani (2012): Without a doubt, God knows what they conceal and what they reveal. He does not like the arrogant

24.Talal Itani (2012): And when it is said to them, 'What has your Lord sent down?' They say, 'Legends of the ancients.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): So let them carry their loads complete on the Day of Resurrection, and some of the loads of those they misguided without knowledge. Evil is what they carry

26.Talal Itani (2012): Those before them also schemed, but God took their structures from the foundations, and the roof caved in on them. The punishment came at them from where they did not perceive

27.Talal Itani (2012): Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them, and say, 'Where are My associates for whose sake you used to dispute?' Those who were given knowledge will say, 'Today shame and misery are upon the disbelievers.'

28.Talal Itani (2012): Those wronging their souls while the angels are taking them away—they will propose peace: 'We did no wrong.' Yes you did. God is aware of what you used to do.'

29.Talal Itani (2012): Enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein forever. Miserable is the residence of the arrogant

30.Talal Itani (2012): And it will be said to those who maintained piety, 'What has your Lord revealed?' They will say, 'Goodness.' To those who do good in this world is goodness, and the Home of the Hereafter is even better. How wonderful is the residence of the pious

31.Talal Itani (2012): The Gardens of Perpetuity, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow, where they will have whatever they desire. Thus God rewards the pious

32.Talal Itani (2012): Those who are in a wholesome state when the angels take them—will say, 'Peace be upon you; enter Paradise, for what you used to do.'

33.Talal Itani (2012): Are they but waiting for the angels to come to them, or for the command of your Lord to arrive? Those before them did likewise. God did not wrong them, but they used to wrong their own souls

34.Talal Itani (2012): So the evils of their deeds assailed them, and what they used to ridicule engulfed them

35.Talal Itani (2012): The idolaters say, 'Had God willed, we would not have worshiped anything besides Him, neither us, nor our ancestors, nor would we have prohibited anything besides His prohibitions.' Those before them did likewise. Are the messengers responsible for anything but clear communication

36.Talal Itani (2012): To every community We sent a messenger: 'Worship God, and avoid idolatry.' Some of them God guided, while others deserved misguidance. So travel through the earth, and see what the fate of the deniers was

37.Talal Itani (2012): Even though you may be concerned about their guidance, God does not guide those who misguide. And they will have no saviors

38.Talal Itani (2012): And they swear by God with their most solemn oaths, 'God will not resurrect anyone who dies.' Yes indeed, it is a promise binding on Him, but most people do not know

39.Talal Itani (2012): To clarify for them what they differed about, and for the faithless to know that they were liars

40.Talal Itani (2012): When We intend for something to happen, We say to it, 'Be,' and it becomes

41.Talal Itani (2012): Those who emigrate for God's sake after being persecuted, We will settle them in a good place in this world; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew

42.Talal Itani (2012): Those who endure patiently, and in their Lord they put their trust

43.Talal Itani (2012): We did not send before you except men whom We inspired. So ask the people of knowledge, if you do not know

44.Talal Itani (2012): With the clarifications and the scriptures. And We revealed to you the Reminder, that you may clarify to the people what was revealed to them, and that they may reflect

45.Talal Itani (2012): Do those who scheme evils feel secure that God will not cause the earth to cave in with them, or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive

46.Talal Itani (2012): Or that He will not seize them during their activities? And they will not be able to prevent it

47.Talal Itani (2012): Or that He will not seize them while in dread? Your Lord is Gentle and Merciful

48.Talal Itani (2012): Have they not observed what God has created? Their shadows revolve from the right and the left, bowing to God as they shrink away

49.Talal Itani (2012): To God bows down everything in the heavens and everything on earth—every living creature, and the angels, and without being proud

50.Talal Itani (2012): They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded

51.Talal Itani (2012): God has said: 'Do not take two gods; He is only One God; so fear only Me.'

52.Talal Itani (2012): To Him belongs everything in the heavens and the earth; and to Him obedience is due always. Do you, then, fear anyone other than God

53.Talal Itani (2012): Whatever blessing you have is from God. And when harm touches you, it is to Him that you groan

54.Talal Itani (2012): But when He lifts the harm from you, some of you associate others with their Lord

55.Talal Itani (2012): To show ingratitude for what We have given them. Enjoy yourselves. You will soon know

56.Talal Itani (2012): And they allocate, to something they do not know, a share of what We have provided for them. By God, you will be questioned about what you have been inventing

57.Talal Itani (2012): And they attribute to God daughters—exalted is He—and for themselves what they desire

58.Talal Itani (2012): And when one of them is given news of a female infant, his face darkens, and he chokes with grief

59.Talal Itani (2012): He hides from the people because of the bad news given to him. Shall he keep it in humiliation, or bury it in the dust? Evil is the decision they make

60.Talal Itani (2012): Those who do not believe in the Hereafter set a bad example, while God sets the Highest Example. He is the Mighty, the Wise

61.Talal Itani (2012): If God were to hold mankind for their injustices, He would not leave upon it a single creature, but He postpones them until an appointed time. Then, when their time arrives, they will not delay it by one hour, nor will they advance it

62.Talal Itani (2012): And they attribute to God what they themselves dislike, while their tongues utter the lie that theirs is the goodness. Without a doubt, for them is the Fire, and they will be neglected

63.Talal Itani (2012): By God, We sent messengers to communities before you, but Satan made their deeds appear alluring to them. He is their master today, and they will have a painful punishment

64.Talal Itani (2012): We revealed to you the Scripture only to clarify for them what they differ about, and guidance and mercy for people who believe

65.Talal Itani (2012): God sends down water from the sky, with which He revives the earth after its death. In this is a sign for people who listen

66.Talal Itani (2012): And there is a lesson for you in cattle: We give you a drink from their bellies, from between waste and blood, pure milk, refreshing to the drinkers

67.Talal Itani (2012): And from the fruits of date-palms and grapevines, you derive sugar and wholesome food. In this is a sign for people who understand

68.Talal Itani (2012): And your Lord inspired the bee: 'Set up hives in the mountains, and in the trees, and in what they construct.'

69.Talal Itani (2012): Then eat of all the fruits, and go along the pathways of your Lord, with precision. From their bellies emerges a fluid of diverse colors, containing healing for the people. Surely in this is a sign for people who reflect

70.Talal Itani (2012): God created you; then He takes you away. Some of you will be brought back to the worst age, so that he will no longer know anything, after having acquired knowledge. God is Omniscient and Omnipotent

71.Talal Itani (2012): God has favored some of you over others in livelihood. Those who are favored would not give their properties to their servants, to the extent of making them partners in it. Will they then renounce God's blessings

72.Talal Itani (2012): God has given you mates from among yourselves; and has produced for you, from your mates, children and grandchildren; and has provided you with good things. Will they then believe in falsehood, and refuse God's favors

73.Talal Itani (2012): And yet they serve besides God what possesses no provisions for them in the heavens, nor on earth, nor are they capable

74.Talal Itani (2012): So do not cite the examples for God. God knows, and you do not know

75.Talal Itani (2012): God cites the example of a bonded slave, who has no power over anything; and someone to whom We have given plentiful provision, from which he gives secretly and openly. Are they equal in comparison? All praise belongs to God, but most of them do not know

76.Talal Itani (2012): And God cites the example of two men: one of them dumb, unable to do anything, and is a burden on his master; whichever way he directs him, he achieves nothing good. Is he equal to him who commands justice, and is on a straight path

77.Talal Itani (2012): To God belongs the unseen of the heavens and the earth. The coming of the Hour is only as the twinkling of the eye, or even nearer. God has power over everything

78.Talal Itani (2012): God brought you out of your mothers' wombs, not knowing anything; and He gave you the hearing, and the eyesight, and the brains; that you may give thanks

79.Talal Itani (2012): Have they not seen the birds, flying in the midst of the sky? None sustains them except God. In this are signs for people who believe

80.Talal Itani (2012): And God has given you in your homes habitats for you, and has provided for you out of the hides of livestock portable homes for you, so you can use them when you travel, and when you camp; and from their wool, and fur, and hair, furnishings and comfort for a while

81.Talal Itani (2012): And God has made for you shade out of what He has created, and has given you resorts in the mountains, and has given you garments to protect you from the heat, and garments to protect you from your violence. Thus He completes His blessings upon you, so that you may submit

82.Talal Itani (2012): But if they turn away, your only duty is clear communication

83.Talal Itani (2012): They recognize God's blessing, but then deny it, as most of them are ungrateful

84.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when We raise up a witness from every community—those who disbelieved will not be permitted, nor will they be excused

85.Talal Itani (2012): When those who did wrong see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved

86.Talal Itani (2012): And when the idolaters see their associates, they will say, 'Our Lord, these are our associates whom we used to invoke besides You.' They will strike back at them with the saying, 'Surely you are liars.'

87.Talal Itani (2012): On that Day they will offer their submission to God, and what they had invented will abandon them

88.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve and obstruct from God's path—We will add punishment to their punishment, on account of the mischief they used to make

89.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when We raise in every community a witness against them, from among them, and bring you as a witness against these. We have revealed to you the Book, as an explanation of all things, and guidance, and mercy and good news for those who submit

90.Talal Itani (2012): God commands justice, and goodness, and generosity towards relatives. And He forbids immorality, and injustice, and oppression. He advises you, so that you may take heed

91.Talal Itani (2012): Fulfill God's covenant when you make a covenant, and do not break your oaths after ratifying them. You have made God your guarantor, and God knows what you do

92.Talal Itani (2012): And do not be like her who unravels her yarn, breaking it into pieces, after she has spun it strongly. Nor use your oaths as means of deception among you, because one community is more prosperous than another. God is testing you thereby. On the Day of Resurrection, He will make clear to you everything you had disputed about.

93.Talal Itani (2012): Had God willed, He would have made you one congregation, but He leaves astray whom He wills, and He guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do

94.Talal Itani (2012): And do not use your oaths to deceive one another, so that a foot may not slip after being firm, and you taste misery because you hindered from God's path, and incur a terrible torment

95.Talal Itani (2012): And do not exchange God's covenant for a small price. What is with God is better for you, if you only knew

96.Talal Itani (2012): What you have runs out, but what is with God remains. We will reward those who are patient according to the best of their deeds

97.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever works righteousness, whether male or female, while being a believer, We will grant him a good life—and We will reward them according to the best of what they used to do

98.Talal Itani (2012): When you read the Quran, seek refuge with God from Satan the outcast

99.Talal Itani (2012): He has no authority over those who believe and trust in their Lord

100.Talal Itani (2012): His authority is only over those who follow him, and those who associate others with Him

101.Talal Itani (2012): When We substitute a verse in place of another verse—and God knows best what He reveals—they say, 'You are an impostor.' But most of them do not know

102.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'The Holy Spirit has brought it down from your Lord, truthfully, in order to stabilize those who believe, and as guidance and good news for those who submit.'

103.Talal Itani (2012): We are well aware that they say, 'It is a human being who is teaching him.' But the tongue of him they allude to is foreign, while this is a clear Arabic tongue

104.Talal Itani (2012): Those who do not believe in God's revelations—God will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment

105.Talal Itani (2012): It is those who do not believe in God's revelations who fabricate falsehood. These are the liars

106.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever renounces faith in God after having believed—except for someone who is compelled, while his heart rests securely in faith—but whoever willingly opens up his heart to disbelief—upon them falls wrath from God, and for them is a tremendous torment

107.Talal Itani (2012): That is because they have preferred the worldly life to the Hereafter, and because God does not guide the people who refuse

108.Talal Itani (2012): It is they whom God has sealed their hearts, and their hearing, and their sight. It is they who are the heedless

109.Talal Itani (2012): There is no doubt that in the Hereafter they will be the losers

110.Talal Itani (2012): But then your Lord—for those who emigrated after being persecuted, then struggled and persevered—your Lord thereafter is Forgiving and Merciful

111.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when every soul will come pleading for itself, and every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and they will not be wronged

112.Talal Itani (2012): And God cites the example of a town that was secure and peaceful, with its livelihood coming to it abundantly from every direction. But then it turned unappreciative of God's blessings, so God made it taste the robe of hunger and fear, because of what they used to craft

113.Talal Itani (2012): A messenger from among them had come to them, but they denounced him, so the punishment seized them in the midst of their wrongdoing

114.Talal Itani (2012): Eat of the lawful and good things God has provided for you, and be thankful for God's blessings, if it is Him that you serve

115.Talal Itani (2012): He has forbidden you carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and anything consecrated to other than God. But if anyone is compelled by necessity, without being deliberate or malicious, then God is Forgiving and Merciful

116.Talal Itani (2012): And do not say of falsehood asserted by your tongues, 'This is lawful, and this is unlawful,' in order to invent lies and attribute them to God. Those who invent lies and attribute them to God will not succeed

117.Talal Itani (2012): A brief enjoyment—then they will have a painful punishment

118.Talal Itani (2012): For those who are Jews, We have prohibited what We related to you before. We did not wrong them, but they used to wrong their own selves

119.Talal Itani (2012): But towards those who do wrongs in ignorance, and then repent afterwards and reform, your Lord thereafter is Forgiving and Merciful

120.Talal Itani (2012): Abraham was an exemplary leader, devoted to God, a monotheist, and was not of the polytheists

121.Talal Itani (2012): Thankful for His blessings. He chose him, and guided him to a straight path

122.Talal Itani (2012): And We gave him goodness in this world, and in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous

123.Talal Itani (2012): Then We inspired you: 'Follow the religion of Abraham, the Monotheist. He was not an idol-worshiper.'

124.Talal Itani (2012): The Sabbath was decreed only for those who differed about it. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding their differences

125.Talal Itani (2012): Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good advice, and debate with them in the most dignified manner. Your Lord is aware of those who stray from His path, and He is aware of those who are guided

126.Talal Itani (2012): If you were to retaliate, retaliate to the same degree as the injury done to you. But if you resort to patience—it is better for the patient

127.Talal Itani (2012): So be patient. Your patience is solely from God. And do not grieve over them, and do not be stressed by their schemes

128.Talal Itani (2012): God is with those who are righteous and those who are virtuous

1.Talal Itani (2012): Glory to Him who journeyed His servant by night, from the Sacred Mosque, to the Farthest Mosque, whose precincts We have blessed, in order to show him of Our wonders. He is the Listener, the Beholder

2.Talal Itani (2012): And We gave Moses the Scripture, and made it a guide for the Children of Israel: Take none for protector other than Me

3.Talal Itani (2012): The descendants of those We carried with Noah. He was an appreciative servant

4.Talal Itani (2012): And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture: You will commit evil on earth twice, and you will rise to a great height

5.Talal Itani (2012): When the first of the two promises came true, We sent against you servants of Ours, possessing great might, and they ransacked your homes. It was a promise fulfilled

6.Talal Itani (2012): Then We gave you back your turn against them, and supplied you with wealth and children, and made you more numerous

7.Talal Itani (2012): If you work righteousness, you work righteousness for yourselves; and if you commit evil, you do so against yourselves. Then, when the second promise comes true, they will make your faces filled with sorrow, and enter the Temple as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy all that falls into their power

8.Talal Itani (2012): Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you. But if you revert, We will revert. We have made Hell a prison for the disbelievers

9.Talal Itani (2012): This Quran guides to what is most upright; and it gives good news to the believers who do good deeds, that they will have a great reward

10.Talal Itani (2012): And those who do not believe in the Hereafter—We have prepared for them a painful punishment

11.Talal Itani (2012): The human being prays for evil as he prays for good. The human being is very hasty

12.Talal Itani (2012): We have made the night and the day two wonders. We erased the wonder of the night, and made the wonder of the day revealing, that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and know the number of years, and the calculation. We have explained all things in detail

13.Talal Itani (2012): For every person We have attached his fate to his neck. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will bring out for him a book which he will find spread open

14.Talal Itani (2012): 'Read your book; today there will be none but yourself to call you to account.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever is guided—is guided for his own good. And whoever goes astray—goes astray to his detriment. No burdened soul carries the burdens of another, nor do We ever punish until We have sent a messenger

16.Talal Itani (2012): When We decide to destroy a town, We command its affluent ones, they transgress in it, so the word becomes justified against it, and We destroy it completely

17.Talal Itani (2012): How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? Your Lord is sufficient as Knower and Beholder of the sins of his servants

18.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever desires the fleeting life, We expedite for him what We decide to give him, to whomever We desire. Then We consign him to Hell, where he will roast, condemned and defeated

19.Talal Itani (2012): But whoever desires the Hereafter, and pursues it as it should be pursued, while he is a believer; these—their effort will be appreciated

20.Talal Itani (2012): To all—these and those—We extend from the gifts of your Lord. The gifts of your Lord are not restricted

21.Talal Itani (2012): See how We have favored some of them over others; yet the Hereafter is greater in ranks, and greater in favors

22.Talal Itani (2012): Do not set up another god with God, lest you become condemned and damned

23.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord has commanded that you worship none but Him, and that you be good to your parents. If either of them or both of them reach old age with you, do not say to them a word of disrespect, nor scold them, but say to them kind words

24.Talal Itani (2012): And lower to them the wing of humility, out of mercy, and say, 'My Lord, have mercy on them, as they raised me when I was a child.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord knows best what is in your minds. If you are righteous—He is Forgiving to the obedient

26.Talal Itani (2012): And give the relative his rights, and the poor, and the wayfarer, and do not squander wastefully

27.Talal Itani (2012): The extravagant are brethren of the devils, and the devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord

28.Talal Itani (2012): But if you turn away from them, seeking mercy from your Lord which you hope for, then say to them words of comfort

29.Talal Itani (2012): And do not keep your hand tied to your neck, nor spread it out fully, lest you end up liable and regretful

30.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord expands the provision for whomever He wills, and restricts it. He is fully Informed, Observant of His servants

31.Talal Itani (2012): And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them, and for you. Killing them is a grave sin

32.Talal Itani (2012): And do not come near adultery. It is immoral, and an evil way

33.Talal Itani (2012): And do not kill the soul which God has made sacred, except in the course of justice. If someone is killed unjustly, We have given his next of kin certain authority. But he should not be excessive in killing, for he will be supported

34.Talal Itani (2012): And do not go near the orphan's property, except with the best of intentions, until he has reached his maturity. And honor your pledge, because the pledge involves responsibility

35.Talal Itani (2012): And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with accurate scales. That is fair, and the best determination

36.Talal Itani (2012): And do not occupy yourself with what you have no knowledge of. The hearing, and the sight, and the brains—all these will be questioned

37.Talal Itani (2012): And do not walk proudly on earth. You can neither pierce the earth, nor can you match the mountains in height

38.Talal Itani (2012): The evil of all these is disliked by your Lord

39.Talal Itani (2012): That is some of the wisdom your Lord has revealed to you. Do not set up with God another god, or else you will be thrown in Hell, rebuked and banished

40.Talal Itani (2012): Has your Lord favored you with sons, while choosing for Himself daughters from among the angels? You are indeed saying a terrible thing

41.Talal Itani (2012): We have explained in this Quran in various ways, that they may remember, but it only adds to their rebellion

42.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If there were other gods with Him, as they say, they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne.'

43.Talal Itani (2012): Be He glorified. He is exalted, far above what they say

44.Talal Itani (2012): Praising Him are the seven heavens, and the earth, and everyone in them. There is not a thing that does not glorify Him with praise, but you do not understand their praises. He is indeed Forbearing and Forgiving

45.Talal Itani (2012): When you read the Quran, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter an invisible barrier

46.Talal Itani (2012): And We drape veils over their hearts, preventing them from understanding it, and heaviness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion

47.Talal Itani (2012): We know well what they listen to, when they listen to you, as they conspire, when the wrongdoers say, 'You only follow a man bewitched.'

48.Talal Itani (2012): Note what they compared you to. They are lost, and unable to find a way

49.Talal Itani (2012): And they say, 'When we have become bones and fragments, shall we really be resurrected as a new creation?'

50.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Even if you become rocks or iron

51.Talal Itani (2012): Or some substance, which, in your minds, is even harder.' Then they will say, 'Who will restore us?' Say, 'The One who originated you the first time.' Then they will nod their heads at you, and say, 'When will it be?' Say, 'Perhaps it will be soon.'

52.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when He calls you, you will respond with His praise, and you will realize that you stayed only a little

53.Talal Itani (2012): Tell My servants to say what is best. Satan sows discord among them. Satan is to man an open enemy.

54.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will have mercy on you; and if He wills, He will punish you. We did not send you as their advocate

55.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord knows well everyone in the heavens and the earth. We have given some prophets advantage over others; and to David We gave the Psalms

56.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Call upon those you claim besides Him. They have no power to relieve your adversity, nor can they change it.'

57.Talal Itani (2012): Those they call upon are themselves seeking means of access to their Lord, vying to be nearer, and hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. The punishment of your Lord is to be dreaded

58.Talal Itani (2012): There is no city but We will destroy before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with a severe punishment. This is inscribed in the Book

59.Talal Itani (2012): Nothing prevents Us from sending miraculous signs, except that the ancients called them lies. We gave Thamood the she-camel, a visible sign, but they mistreated her. We do not send the signs except to instill reverence

60.Talal Itani (2012): We said to you that your Lord encompasses humanity. We did not make the vision We showed you, except as a test for the people, and the tree cursed in the Quran. We frighten them, but that only increases their defiance

61.Talal Itani (2012): When We said to the angels, 'Bow down before Adam,' they bowed down, except for Satan. He said, 'Shall I bow down before someone You created from mud?'

62.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Do You see this one whom You have honored more than me? If You reprieve me until the Day of Resurrection, I will bring his descendants under my sway, except for a few.'

63.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Begone! Whoever of them follows you—Hell is your reward, an ample reward.'

64.Talal Itani (2012): 'And entice whomever of them you can with your voice, and rally against them your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and make promises to them.' But Satan promises them nothing but delusion

65.Talal Itani (2012): 'As for My devotees, you have no authority over them.' Your Lord is an adequate Guardian

66.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord is He who propels for you the ships at sea, that you may seek of His bounty. He is towards you Most Merciful

67.Talal Itani (2012): When harm afflicts you at sea, those you pray to vanish, except for Him. But when He saves you to land, you turn away. The human being is ever thankless

68.Talal Itani (2012): Are you confident that He will not cause a track of land to cave in beneath you, or unleash a tornado against you, and then you find no protector

69.Talal Itani (2012): Or are you confident that He will not return you to it once again, and unleash a hurricane against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will find no helper against Us

70.Talal Itani (2012): We have honored the Children of Adam, and carried them on land and sea, and provided them with good things, and greatly favored them over many of those We created

71.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when We call every people with their leader. Whoever is given his record in his right hand—these will read their record, and they will not be wronged one bit

72.Talal Itani (2012): But whoever is blind in this, he will be blind in the Hereafter, and further astray from the way

73.Talal Itani (2012): They almost lured you away from what We have revealed to you, so that you would invent something else in Our name. In that case, they would have taken you for a friend

74.Talal Itani (2012): Had We not given you stability, you might have inclined towards them a little

75.Talal Itani (2012): Then We would have made you taste double in life, and double at death; then you would have found for yourself no helper against Us

76.Talal Itani (2012): They almost provoked you, to expel you from the land. In that case, they would not have lasted after you, except briefly

77.Talal Itani (2012): The tradition of the messengers We sent before you—you will find no change in Our rules

78.Talal Itani (2012): Perform the prayer at the decline of the sun, until the darkness of the night; and the Quran at dawn. The Quran at dawn is witnessed

79.Talal Itani (2012): And keep vigil with it during parts of the night, as an extra prayer. Perhaps your Lord will raise you to a laudable position

80.Talal Itani (2012): And say, 'My Lord, lead me in through an entry of truth, and lead me out through an exit of truth, and grant me from You a supporting power.'

81.Talal Itani (2012): And say, 'The truth has come, and falsehood has withered away; for falsehood is bound to wither away.'

82.Talal Itani (2012): We send down in the Quran healing and mercy for the believers, but it increases the wrongdoers only in loss

83.Talal Itani (2012): When We bless the human being, he turns away and distances himself. But when adversity touches him, he is in despair

84.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Each does according to his disposition. Your Lord knows best who is better guided in the way.'

85.Talal Itani (2012): And they ask you about the Spirit. Say, 'The Spirit belongs to the domain of my Lord; and you were given only little knowledge.'

86.Talal Itani (2012): If We willed, We could take away what We revealed to you. Then you will find for yourself no protecting guardian against Us

87.Talal Itani (2012): Except through a mercy from your Lord. His favors upon you have been great

88.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If mankind and jinn came together to produce the like of this Quran, they could never produce the like of it, even if they backed up one another.'

89.Talal Itani (2012): We have displayed for mankind in this Quran every kind of similitude, but most people insist on denying the truth

90.Talal Itani (2012): And they said, 'We will not believe in you unless you make a spring burst from the ground for us

91.Talal Itani (2012): Or you have a garden of palms and vines; then cause rivers to gush pouring through them

92.Talal Itani (2012): Or make the sky fall on us in pieces, as you claim, or bring God and the angels before us

93.Talal Itani (2012): Or you possess a house of gold. Or you ascend into the sky. Even then, we will not believe in your ascension, unless you bring down for us a book that we can read.' Say, 'Glory be to my Lord. Am I anything but a human messenger?'

94.Talal Itani (2012): Nothing prevented the people from believing, when guidance has come to them, except that they said, 'Did God send a human messenger?'

95.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If there were angels on earth, walking around in peace, We would have sent down to them from heaven an angel messenger.'

96.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'God is enough witness between you and me. He is fully aware of His servants, and He sees them well.'

97.Talal Itani (2012): Whomever God guides is the guided one. And whomever He leaves astray—for them you will find no protectors apart from Him. And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection, on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf. Their abode is Hell; whenever it abates, We intensify the blaze for them

98.Talal Itani (2012): This is their repayment for having blasphemed against Our revelations, and having said, 'Shall we, when we have become bones and fragments, be resurrected as a new creation?'

99.Talal Itani (2012): Do they not consider that God, Who created the heavens and the earth, is Able to create the likes of them? He has assigned for them a term, in which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denying the truth

100.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If you possessed the treasuries of my Lord's mercy, you would have withheld them for fear of spending.' The human being has always been stingy

101.Talal Itani (2012): We gave Moses nine clear signs—ask the Children of Israel. When he went to them, Pharaoh said to him, 'I think that you, Moses, are bewitched.'

102.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'You know that none sent these down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth—eye openers; and I think that you, Pharaoh, are doomed.'

103.Talal Itani (2012): He resolved to scare them off the land, but We drowned him, and those with him, altogether

104.Talal Itani (2012): After him, We said to the Children of Israel, 'Inhabit the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter arrives, We will bring you all together.'

105.Talal Itani (2012): With the truth We sent it down, and with the truth it descended. We sent you only as a bearer of good news and a warner

106.Talal Itani (2012): A Quran which We unfolded gradually, that you may recite to the people over time. And We revealed it in stages

107.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Believe in it, or do not believe.' Those who were given knowledge before it, when it is recited to them, they fall to their chins, prostrating

108.Talal Itani (2012): And they say, 'Glory to our Lord. The promise of our Lord is fulfilled.'

109.Talal Itani (2012): And they fall to their chins, weeping, and it adds to their humility

110.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Call Him God, or call Him the Most Merciful. Whichever name you use, to Him belong the Best Names.' And be neither loud in your prayer, nor silent in it, but follow a course in between

111.Talal Itani (2012): And say, 'Praise be to God, who has not begotten a son, nor has He a partner in sovereignty, nor has He an ally out of weakness, and glorify Him constantly.'

1.Talal Itani (2012): Praise be to God, who revealed the Book to His servant, and allowed in it no distortion

2.Talal Itani (2012): Valuable—to warn of severe punishment from Himself; and to deliver good news to the believers who do righteous deeds, that they will have an excellent reward

3.Talal Itani (2012): In which they will abide forever.

4.Talal Itani (2012): And to warn those who say, 'God has begotten a son.'

5.Talal Itani (2012): They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths. They say nothing but a lie.

6.Talal Itani (2012): Perhaps you may destroy yourself with grief, chasing after them, if they do not believe in this information

7.Talal Itani (2012): We made what is upon the earth an ornament for it, to test them as to which of them is best in conduct

8.Talal Itani (2012): And We will turn what is on it into barren waste

9.Talal Itani (2012): Did you know that the People of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wondrous signs

10.Talal Itani (2012): When the youths took shelter in the cave, they said, 'Our Lord, give us mercy from Yourself, and bless our affair with guidance.'

11.Talal Itani (2012): Then We sealed their ears in the cave for a number of years

12.Talal Itani (2012): Then We awakened them to know which of the two groups could better calculate the length of their stay

13.Talal Itani (2012): We relate to you their story in truth. They were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance

14.Talal Itani (2012): And We strengthened their hearts, when they stood up and said, 'Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth; we will not call on any god besides Him, for then we would have spoken an outrage.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): 'These people, our people, have taken to themselves gods other than Him. Why do they not bring a clear proof concerning them? Who, then, does greater wrong than he who invents lies and attributes them to God?'

16.Talal Itani (2012): 'Now that you have withdrawn from them, and from what they worship besides God, take shelter in the cave. And your Lord will unfold His mercy for you, and will set your affair towards ease.'

17.Talal Itani (2012): You would have seen the sun, when it rose, veering away from their cave towards the right, and when it sets, moving away from them to the left, as they lay in the midst of the cave. That was one of God's wonders. He whom God guides is truly guided; but he whom He misguides, for him you will find no directing friend

18.Talal Itani (2012): You would think them awake, although they were asleep. And We turned them over to the right, and to the left, with their dog stretching its paws across the threshold. Had you looked at them, you would have turned away from them in flight, and been filled with fear of them

19.Talal Itani (2012): Even so, We awakened them, so that they may ask one another. A speaker among them said, 'How long have you stayed?' They said, 'We have stayed a day, or part of a day.' They said, 'Your Lord knows best how long you have stayed.' 'Send one of you to the city, with this money of yours, and let him see which food is most suitable, and let him bring you some provision thereof. And let him be gentle, and let no one become aware of you.'

20.Talal Itani (2012): 'If they discover you, they will stone you, or force you back into their religion; then you will never be saved.'

21.Talal Itani (2012): So it was, that We caused them to be discovered, that they would know that the promise of God is true, and that of the Hour there is no doubt. As they were disputing their case among themselves, they said, 'Build over them a building.' Their Lord knows best about them. Those who prevailed over their case said, 'We will set up over them a place of worship.'

22.Talal Itani (2012): They will say, 'Three, and their fourth being their dog.' And they will say, 'Five, and their sixth being their dog,' guessing at the unknown. And they will say, 'Seven, and their eighth being their dog.' Say, 'My Lord knows best their number.' None knows them except a few. So do not argue concerning them except with an obvious argument, and do not consult any of them about them

23.Talal Itani (2012): And never say about anything, 'I will do that tomorrow.'

24.Talal Itani (2012): Without saying, 'If God wills.' And remember your Lord if you forget, and say, 'Perhaps my Lord will guide me to nearer than this in integrity.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): And they stayed in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine

26.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'God knows best how long they stayed.' His is the mystery of the heavens and the earth. By Him you see and hear. They have no guardian apart from Him, and He shares His Sovereignty with no one

27.Talal Itani (2012): And recite what was revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. There is no changing His words, and you will find no refuge except in Him

28.Talal Itani (2012): And content yourself with those who pray to their Lord morning and evening, desiring His Presence. And do not turn your eyes away from them, desiring the glitter of this world. And do not obey him whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance—so he follows his own desires—and his priorities are confused

29.Talal Itani (2012): And say, 'The truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills—let him believe. And whoever wills—let him disbelieve'. We have prepared for the unjust a Fire, whose curtains will hem them in. And when they cry for relief, they will be relieved with water like molten brass, which scalds the faces. What a miserable drink, and what a terrible place

30.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who believe and lead a righteous life—We will not waste the reward of those who work righteousness

31.Talal Itani (2012): These will have the Gardens of Eden, beneath which rivers flow. Reclining on comfortable furnishings, they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and will wear green garments of silk and brocade. What a wonderful reward, and what an excellent resting-place

32.Talal Itani (2012): And cite for them the parable of two men. To one of them We gave two gardens of vine, and We surrounded them with palms-trees, and We placed between them crops

33.Talal Itani (2012): Both gardens produced their harvest in full, and suffered no loss. And We made a river flow through them

34.Talal Itani (2012): And thus he had abundant fruits. He said to his friend, as he conversed with him, 'I am wealthier than you, and greater in manpower.'

35.Talal Itani (2012): And he entered his garden, wronging himself. He said, 'I do not think this will ever perish.'

36.Talal Itani (2012): 'And I do not think the Hour is coming. And even if I am returned to my Lord, I will find something better than this in return.'

37.Talal Itani (2012): His friend said to him, as he conversed with him, 'Are you being ungrateful to Him who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then evolved you into a man

38.Talal Itani (2012): But as for me, He is God, my Lord, and I never associate with my Lord anyone

39.Talal Itani (2012): When you entered your garden, why did you not say, 'As God wills; there is no power except through God'? Although you see me inferior to you in wealth and children

40.Talal Itani (2012): Perhaps my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and release upon it thunderbolts from the sky, so it becomes barren waste

41.Talal Itani (2012): Or its water will sink into the ground, and you will be unable to draw it.'

42.Talal Itani (2012): And ruin closed in on his crops, and so he began wringing his hands over what he had invested in it, as it lays fallen upon its trellises. And he was saying, 'I wish I never associated anyone with my Lord.'

43.Talal Itani (2012): He had no faction to help him besides God, and he was helpless

44.Talal Itani (2012): That is because authority belongs to God, the True. He is Best in rewarding, and Best in requiting

45.Talal Itani (2012): And cite for them the parable of the present life: it is like water that We send down from the sky; the plants of the earth absorb it; but then it becomes debris, scattered by the wind. God has absolute power over everything

46.Talal Itani (2012): Wealth and children are the adornments of the present life. But the things that last, the virtuous deeds, are better with your Lord for reward, and better for hope

47.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when We set the mountains in motion; and you see the earth emerging; and We gather them together, and leave none of them behind

48.Talal Itani (2012): They will be presented before your Lord in a row. 'You have come to Us as We created you the first time. Although you claimed We would not set a meeting for you.'

49.Talal Itani (2012): And the book will be placed, and you will see the sinners fearful of its contents. And they will say, 'Woe to us! What is with this book that leaves nothing, small or big, but it has enumerated it?' They will find everything they had done present. Your Lord does not wrong anyone.

50.Talal Itani (2012): We said to the angels, 'Bow down to Adam.' So they bowed down, except for Satan. He was of the jinn, and he defied the command of his Lord. Will you take him and his offspring as lords instead of Me, when they are an enemy to you? Evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers

51.Talal Itani (2012): I did not call them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation; and I do not take the misleaders for assistants

52.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when He will say, 'Call on My partners whom you have claimed.' They will call on them, but they will not answer them. And We will place between them a barrier

53.Talal Itani (2012): And the sinners will see the Fire, and will realize that they will tumble into it. They will find no deliverance from it

54.Talal Itani (2012): We have elaborated in this Quran for the people every kind of example, but the human being is a most argumentative being

55.Talal Itani (2012): What prevented people from accepting faith, when guidance has come to them, and from seeking their Lord's forgiveness? Unless they are waiting for the precedent of the ancients to befall them, or to have the punishment come upon them face to face

56.Talal Itani (2012): We send the messengers only as deliverers of good news and warners. Those who disbelieve argue with false argument, in order to defeat the truth thereby. They take My Verses, and the warnings, for a joke

57.Talal Itani (2012): Who does greater wrong than he, who, when reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets what his hands have put forward? We have placed coverings over their hearts, lest they understand it, and heaviness in their ears. And if you call them to guidance, they will not be guided, ever

58.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord is the Forgiver, Possessor of Mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, He would have hastened the punishment for them. But they have an appointment from which they will find no escape

59.Talal Itani (2012): And these towns—We destroyed them when they committed injustices, and We set for their destruction an appointed time

60.Talal Itani (2012): Recall when Moses said to his servant, 'I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two rivers, even if it takes me years.'

61.Talal Itani (2012): Then, when they reached the junction between them, they forgot about their fish. It found its way into the river, slipping away

62.Talal Itani (2012): When they went further, he said to his servant, 'Bring us our lunch; we were exposed in our travel to much fatigue.'

63.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Do you remember when we rested by the rock? I forgot about the fish. It was only the devil who made me forget it. And so it found its way to the river, amazingly.'

64.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'This is what we were seeking.' And so they turned back retracing their steps

65.Talal Itani (2012): Then they came upon a servant of Ours, whom We had blessed with mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our Own

66.Talal Itani (2012): Moses said to him, 'May I follow you, so that you may teach me some of the guidance you were taught?'

67.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'You will not be able to endure with me

68.Talal Itani (2012): And how will you endure what you have no knowledge of?'

69.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'You will find me, God willing, patient; and I will not disobey you in any order of yours.'

70.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'If you follow me, do not ask me about anything, until I myself make mention of it to you.'

71.Talal Itani (2012): So they set out. Until, when they had boarded the boat, he holed it. He said, 'Did you hole it, to drown its passengers? You have done something awful.'

72.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?'

73.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Do not rebuke me for forgetting, and do not make my course difficult for me.'

74.Talal Itani (2012): Then they set out. Until, when they encountered a boy, he killed him. He said, 'Did you kill a pure soul, who killed no one? You have done something terrible.'

75.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?'

76.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'If I ask you about anything after this, then do not keep company with me. You have received excuses from me.'

77.Talal Itani (2012): So they set out. Until, when they reached the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. There they found a wall about to collapse, and he repaired it. He said, 'If you wanted, you could have obtained a payment for it.'

78.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'This is the parting between you and me. I will tell you the interpretation of what you were unable to endure

79.Talal Itani (2012): As for the boat, it belonged to paupers working at sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king coming after them seizing every boat by force

80.Talal Itani (2012): As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared he would overwhelm them with oppression and disbelief

81.Talal Itani (2012): So we wanted their Lord to replace him with someone better in purity, and closer to mercy

82.Talal Itani (2012): And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the town. Beneath it was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man. Your Lord wanted them to reach their maturity, and then extract their treasure—as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own accord. This is the interpretation of what you were unable to endure.'

83.Talal Itani (2012): And they ask you about Zul-Qarnain. Say, 'I will tell you something about him.'

84.Talal Itani (2012): We established him on earth, and gave him all kinds of means

85.Talal Itani (2012): He pursued a certain course

86.Talal Itani (2012): Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it setting in a murky spring, and found a people in its vicinity. We said, 'O Zul-Qarnain, you may either inflict a penalty, or else treat them kindly.'

87.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'As for him who does wrong, we will penalize him, then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with an unheard-of torment

88.Talal Itani (2012): 'But as for him who believes and acts righteously, he will have the finest reward, and We will speak to him of Our command with ease.'

89.Talal Itani (2012): Then he pursued a course

90.Talal Itani (2012): Until, when he reached the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it

91.Talal Itani (2012): And so it was. We had full knowledge of what he had

92.Talal Itani (2012): Then he pursued a course

93.Talal Itani (2012): Until, when he reached the point separating the two barriers, he found beside them a people who could barely understand what is said

94.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'O Zul-Qarnain, the Gog and Magog are spreading chaos in the land. Can we pay you, to build between us and them a wall?'

95.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'What my Lord has empowered me with is better. But assist me with strength, and I will build between you and them a dam.'

96.Talal Itani (2012): 'Bring me blocks of iron.' So that, when he had leveled up between the two cliffs, he said, 'Blow.' And having turned it into a fire, he said, 'Bring me tar to pour over it.'

97.Talal Itani (2012): So they were unable to climb it, and they could not penetrate it

98.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes true, He will turn it into rubble, and the promise of my Lord is always true.'

99.Talal Itani (2012): On that Day, We will leave them surging upon one another. And the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them together

100.Talal Itani (2012): On that Day, We will present the disbelievers to Hell, all displayed

101.Talal Itani (2012): Those whose eyes were screened to My message, and were unable to hear

102.Talal Itani (2012): Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants for masters instead of Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of the faithless

103.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in their works?'

104.Talal Itani (2012): 'Those whose efforts in this world are misguided, while they assume that they are doing well.'

105.Talal Itani (2012): It is they who rejected the communications of their Lord, and the encounter with Him. So their works are in vain. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will consider them of no weight

106.Talal Itani (2012): That is their requital—Hell—on account of their disbelief, and their taking My revelations and My messengers in mockery

107.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, they will have the Gardens of Paradise for hospitality

108.Talal Itani (2012): Abiding therein forever, without desiring any change therefrom

109.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If the ocean were ink for the words of my Lord, the ocean would run out, before the words of my Lord run out,' even if We were to bring the like of it in addition to it

110.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'I am only a human being like you, being inspired that your god is One God. Whoever hopes to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and never associate anyone with the service of his Lord.'

1.Talal Itani (2012): Kaf, Ha, Ya, Ayn, Saad

2.Talal Itani (2012): A mention of the mercy of your Lord towards His servant Zechariah

3.Talal Itani (2012): When he called on his Lord, a call in seclusion

4.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'My Lord, my bones have become feeble, and my hair is aflame with gray, and never, Lord, have I been disappointed in my prayer to you

5.Talal Itani (2012): 'And I fear for my dependents after me, and my wife is barren. So grant me, from Yourself, an heir

6.Talal Itani (2012): To inherit me, and inherit from the House of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, pleasing.'

7.Talal Itani (2012): 'O Zechariah, We give you good news of a son, whose name is John, a name We have never given before.'

8.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'My Lord, how can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have become decrepit with old age?'

9.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'It will be so, your Lord says, 'it is easy for me, and I created you before, when you were nothing.'&#39

10.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'My Lord, give me a sign.' He said, 'Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights straight.'

11.Talal Itani (2012): And he came out to his people, from the sanctuary, and signaled to them to praise morning and evening

12.Talal Itani (2012): 'O John, hold on to the Scripture firmly,' and We gave him wisdom in his youth

13.Talal Itani (2012): And tenderness from Us, and innocence. He was devout

14.Talal Itani (2012): And kind to his parents; and he was not a disobedient tyrant

15.Talal Itani (2012): And peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day he dies, and the Day he is raised alive

16.Talal Itani (2012): And mention in the Scripture Mary, when she withdrew from her people to an eastern location

17.Talal Itani (2012): She screened herself away from them, and We sent to her Our spirit, and He appeared to her as an immaculate human

18.Talal Itani (2012): She said, 'I take refuge from you in the Most Merciful, should you be righteous.'

19.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'I am only the messenger of your Lord, to give you the gift of a pure son.'

20.Talal Itani (2012): She said, 'How can I have a son, when no man has touched me, and I was never unchaste?'

21.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Thus said your Lord, `It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign for humanity, and a mercy from Us. It is a matter already decided.''

22.Talal Itani (2012): So she carried him, and secluded herself with him in a remote place

23.Talal Itani (2012): The labor-pains came upon her, by the trunk of a palm-tree. She said, 'I wish I had died before this, and been completely forgotten.'

24.Talal Itani (2012): Whereupon he called her from beneath her: 'Do not worry; your Lord has placed a stream beneath you

25.Talal Itani (2012): And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, and it will drop ripe dates by you.'

26.Talal Itani (2012): 'So eat, and drink, and be consoled. And if you see any human, say, 'I have vowed a fast to the Most Gracious, so I will not speak to any human today.''

27.Talal Itani (2012): Then she came to her people, carrying him. They said, 'O Mary, you have done something terrible

28.Talal Itani (2012): O sister of Aaron, your father was not an evil man, and your mother was not a whore.'

29.Talal Itani (2012): So she pointed to him. They said, 'How can we speak to an infant in the crib?'

30.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'I am the servant of God. He has given me the Scripture, and made me a prophet

31.Talal Itani (2012): And has made me blessed wherever I may be; and has enjoined on me prayer and charity, so long as I live

32.Talal Itani (2012): And kind to my mother, and He did not make me a disobedient rebel

33.Talal Itani (2012): So Peace is upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the Day I get resurrected alive.'

34.Talal Itani (2012): That is Jesus son of Mary—the Word of truth about which they doubt

35.Talal Itani (2012): It is not for God to have a child—glory be to Him. To have anything done, He says to it, 'Be,' and it becomes

36.Talal Itani (2012): 'God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path.'

37.Talal Itani (2012): But the various factions differed among themselves. So woe to those who disbelieve from the scene of a tremendous Day

38.Talal Itani (2012): Listen to them and watch for them the Day they come to Us. But the wrongdoers today are completely lost

39.Talal Itani (2012): And warn them of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded. Yet they are heedless, and they do not believe

40.Talal Itani (2012): It is We who will inherit the earth and everyone on it, and to Us they will be returned

41.Talal Itani (2012): And mention in the Scripture Abraham. He was a man of truth, a prophet

42.Talal Itani (2012): He said to his father, 'O my father, why do you worship what can neither hear, nor see, nor benefit you in any way

43.Talal Itani (2012): O my father, there has come to me knowledge that never came to you. So follow me, and I will guide you along a straight way

44.Talal Itani (2012): O my father, do not worship the devil. The devil is disobedient to the Most Gracious

45.Talal Itani (2012): O my father, I fear that a punishment from the Most Gracious will afflict you, and you become an ally of the devil.'

46.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Are you renouncing my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will stone you. So leave me alone for a while.'

47.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'Peace be upon you. I will ask my Lord to forgive you; He has been Kind to me

48.Talal Itani (2012): And I will withdraw from you, and from what you pray to instead of God. And I will pray to my Lord, and I hope I will not be disappointed in my prayer to my Lord.'

49.Talal Itani (2012): When he withdrew from them, and from what they worship besides God, We granted him Isaac and Jacob. And each We made a prophet

50.Talal Itani (2012): And We gave them freely of Our mercy, and gave them a noble reputation of truth

51.Talal Itani (2012): And mention in the Scripture Moses. He was dedicated. He was a messenger and a prophet
