42.Talal Itani (2012): You call me to reject God, and to associate with Him what I have no knowledge of, while I call you to the Mighty Forgiver

43.Talal Itani (2012): Without a doubt, what you call me to has no say in this world, or in the Hereafter; and our turning back is to God; and the transgressors are the inmates of the Fire

44.Talal Itani (2012): You will remember what I am telling you, so I commit my case to God. God is Observant of the servants.'

45.Talal Itani (2012): So God protected him from the evils of their scheming, while a terrible torment besieged Pharaoh's clan

46.Talal Itani (2012): The Fire. They will be exposed to it morning and evening. And on the Day the Hour takes place: 'Admit the clan of Pharaoh to the most intense agony.'

47.Talal Itani (2012): As they quarrel in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, 'We were followers of yours; will you then spare us a portion of the Fire?'

48.Talal Itani (2012): Those who were arrogant will say, 'We are all in it; God has judged between the servants.'

49.Talal Itani (2012): And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, 'Call to your Lord to lessen our suffering for one day.'

50.Talal Itani (2012): They will say, 'Did not your messengers come to you with clear signs?' They will say, 'Yes.' They will say, 'Then pray, but the prayers of the disbelievers will always be in vain.'

51.Talal Itani (2012): Most surely We will support Our messengers and those who believe, in this life, and on the Day the witnesses arise

52.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when their excuses will not profit the wrongdoers, and the curse will be upon them, and they will have the Home of Misery

53.Talal Itani (2012): We gave Moses guidance, and made the Children of Israel inherit the Scripture

54.Talal Itani (2012): A guide and a reminder for those endowed with reason

55.Talal Itani (2012): So be patient. The promise of God is true. And ask forgiveness for your sin, and proclaim the praise of your Lord evening and morning

56.Talal Itani (2012): Those who dispute regarding God's revelations without any authority having come to them—there is nothing in their hearts but the feeling of greatness, which they will never attain. So seek refuge in God; for He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing

57.Talal Itani (2012): Certainly the creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of humanity, but most people do not know

58.Talal Itani (2012): Not equal are the blind and the seeing. Nor are those who believe and work righteousness equal to the sinners. How little you reflect

59.Talal Itani (2012): Indeed, the Hour is coming; there is no doubt about it; but most people do not believe

60.Talal Itani (2012): Your Lord has said, 'Pray to Me, and I will respond to you. But those who are too proud to worship Me will enter Hell forcibly.'

61.Talal Itani (2012): It is God Who made the night for you, that you may rest therein; and the day allowing sight. God is gracious towards the people, but most people do not give thanks

62.Talal Itani (2012): Such is God, your Lord, Creator of all things. There is no god except Him; so how could you turn away

63.Talal Itani (2012): Thus are turned away those who dispute the signs of God

64.Talal Itani (2012): It is God who made the earth a habitat for you, and the sky a structure. And He designed you, and designed you well; and He provided you with the good things. Such is God, your Lord; so Blessed is God, Lord of the Worlds

65.Talal Itani (2012): He is the Living One. There is no god except He. So pray to Him, devoting your religion to Him. Praise be to God, the Lord of the Worlds

66.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'I was prohibited from worshiping those you invoke besides God, now that clear revelations have come to me from my Lord; and I was commanded to submit to the Lord of the Worlds.'

67.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who created you from dust, then from a seed, then from an embryo, then He brings you out as an infant, then He lets you reach your maturity, then you become elderly—although some of you die sooner—so that you may reach a predetermined age, so that you may understand

68.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who gives life and death; and when He decides on a thing, He just says to it, 'Be,' and it comes to be

69.Talal Itani (2012): Have you not observed those who dispute regarding God's revelations, how they have deviated

70.Talal Itani (2012): Those who call the Book a lie, and what We sent Our messengers with—they will surely know

71.Talal Itani (2012): When the yokes are around their necks, and they will be dragged by the chains

72.Talal Itani (2012): Into the boiling water, then in the Fire they will be consumed

73.Talal Itani (2012): Then it will be said to them, 'Where are those you used to deify

74.Talal Itani (2012): Instead of God?' They will say, 'They have abandoned us. In fact, we were praying to nothing before.' Thus God sends the disbelievers astray

75.Talal Itani (2012): That is because you used to rejoice on earth in other than the truth, and because you used to behave with vanity

76.Talal Itani (2012): Enter the gates of Hell, to remain therein forever. What a terrible dwelling for the arrogant

77.Talal Itani (2012): So be patient. The promise of God is true. Whether We show you some of what We have promised them, or take you to Us, to Us they will be returned

78.Talal Itani (2012): We sent messengers before you. Some of them We told you about, and some We did not tell you about. No messenger can bring a miracle except by leave of God. Then, when the command of God is issued, fair judgment will be passed, and there and then the seekers of vanity will lose

79.Talal Itani (2012): God is He who created the domestic animals for you—some for you to ride, and some you eat

80.Talal Itani (2012): And in them you have other benefits as well, and through them you satisfy your needs. And on them, and on the ships, you are transported

81.Talal Itani (2012): And He shows you His signs. So which of God's signs will you deny

82.Talal Itani (2012): Have they not journeyed through the land, and seen the outcome for those before them? They were more numerous than they, and had greater power and influence in the land. But what they had achieved availed them nothing

83.Talal Itani (2012): When their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they rejoiced in the knowledge they had, and the very things they used to ridicule besieged them

84.Talal Itani (2012): Then, when they witnessed Our might, they said, 'We believe in God alone, and we reject what we used to associate with Him.'

85.Talal Itani (2012): But their faith could not help them once they witnessed Our might. This has been God's way of dealing with His servants. And there and then the disbelievers lost

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): A revelation from the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

3.Talal Itani (2012): A Scripture whose Verses are detailed, a Quran in Arabic for people who know

4.Talal Itani (2012): Bringing good news, and giving warnings. But most of them turn away, so they do not listen

5.Talal Itani (2012): And they say, 'Our hearts are screened from what you call us to, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a barrier. So do what you want, and so will we.'

6.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'I am only a human like you; it is inspired in me that your God is One God. So be upright towards Him, and seek forgiveness from Him.' And woe to the idolaters

7.Talal Itani (2012): Those who do not pay the alms; and regarding the Hereafter, they are disbelievers

8.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who believe and do righteous deeds—for them is a reward uninterrupted

9.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Do you reject the One who created the earth in two days? And you attribute equals to Him? That is the Lord of the Universe.'

10.Talal Itani (2012): He placed stabilizers over it; and blessed it; and planned its provisions in four days, equally to the seekers

11.Talal Itani (2012): Then He turned to the sky, and it was smoke, and said to it and to the earth, 'Come, willingly or unwillingly.' They said, 'We come willingly.'

12.Talal Itani (2012): So He completed them as seven universes in two days, and He assigned to each universe its laws. And We decorated the lower universe with lamps, and for protection. That is the design of the Almighty, the All-Knowing

13.Talal Itani (2012): But if they turn away, say, 'I have warned you of a thunderbolt, like the thunderbolt of Aad and Thamood.'

14.Talal Itani (2012): Their messengers came to them, from before them and from behind them, saying, 'Do not worship anyone but God.' They said, 'Had our Lord willed, He would have sent down angels; Therefore, we reject what you are sent with.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): As for Aad, they turned arrogant on earth, and opposed justice, and said, 'Who is more powerful than us?' Have they not considered that God, who created them, is more powerful than they? And they went on denying Our revelations

16.Talal Itani (2012): So We unleashed upon them a screaming wind, for a few miserable days, to make them taste the punishment of shame in this life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more shameful; and they will not be saved

17.Talal Itani (2012): And as for Thamood, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance. So the thunderbolt of the humiliating punishment seized them, because of what they used to earn

18.Talal Itani (2012): And We saved those who believed and were righteous

19.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when God's enemies are herded into the Fire, forcibly

20.Talal Itani (2012): Until, when they have reached it, their hearing, and their sight, and their skins will testify against them regarding what they used to do

21.Talal Itani (2012): And they will say to their skins, 'Why did you testify against us?' They will say, 'God, Who made all things speak, made us speak. It is He who created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.'

22.Talal Itani (2012): You were unable to hide yourselves from your hearing, and your sight, and your skins, to prevent them from testifying against you, and you imagined that God was unaware of much of what you do

23.Talal Itani (2012): It is that thought of yours about your Lord that led you to ruin—so you became of the losers

24.Talal Itani (2012): If they endure patiently, the Fire will be their residence; and if they make up excuses, they will not be pardoned

25.Talal Itani (2012): We had assigned companions for them, who glamorized to them what was in front of them, and what was behind them. And the Word proved true against them in communities of jinn and humans that have passed away before them. They were losers

26.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve say, 'Do not listen to this Quran, and talk over it, so that you may prevail.'

27.Talal Itani (2012): We will make those who disbelieve taste an intense agony, and We will recompense them according to the worst of what they used to do

28.Talal Itani (2012): Such is the recompense of God's enemies—the Fire—where they will have their permanent home, in recompense for having disregarded Our revelations

29.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieved will say, 'Our Lord, show us those who led us astray—among jinn and humans—and we will trample them under our feet, so they become among of the lowest.'

30.Talal Itani (2012): Surely, those who say: 'Our Lord is God,' and then go straight, the angels will descend upon them: 'Do not fear, and do not grieve, but rejoice in the news of the Garden which you were promised

31.Talal Itani (2012): We are your allies in this life and in the Hereafter, wherein you will have whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you call for

32.Talal Itani (2012): As Hospitality from an All-Forgiving, Merciful One.'

33.Talal Itani (2012): And who is better in speech than someone who calls to God, and acts with integrity, and says, 'I am of those who submit'

34.Talal Itani (2012): Good and evil are not equal. Repel evil with good, and the person who was your enemy becomes like an intimate friend

35.Talal Itani (2012): But none will attain it except those who persevere, and none will attain it except the very fortunate

36.Talal Itani (2012): When a temptation from the Devil provokes you, seek refuge in God; He is the Hearer, the Knower

37.Talal Itani (2012): And of His signs are the night and the day, and the sun and the moon. Do not bow down to the sun, nor to the moon, but bow down to God, Who created them both, if it is Him that you serve

38.Talal Itani (2012): But if they are too proud—those in the presence of your Lord praise Him night and day, and without ever tiring

39.Talal Itani (2012): And of His signs is that you see the land still. But when We send down water upon it, it stirs and grows. Surely, He Who revived it will revive the dead. He is Able to do all things

40.Talal Itani (2012): Those who despise Our revelations are not hidden from Us. Is he who is hurled into the Fire better? Or he who arrives safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you please; He is Seeing of everything you do

41.Talal Itani (2012): Those who reject the Reminder when it has come to them—it is an invincible Book

42.Talal Itani (2012): Falsehood cannot approach it, from before it or behind it. It is a revelation from One Wise and Praiseworthy

43.Talal Itani (2012): Nothing is said to you but was said to the Messengers before you: your Lord is Possessor of Forgiveness, and Possessor of Painful Repayment

44.Talal Itani (2012): Had We made it a Quran in a foreign language, they would have said, 'If only its verses were made clear.' Non-Arabic and an Arab? Say, 'For those who believe, it is guidance and healing. But as for those who do not believe: there is heaviness in their ears, and it is blindness for them. These are being called from a distant place.'

45.Talal Itani (2012): We gave Moses the Book, but disputes arose concerning it. Were it not for a prior decree from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. But they are in perplexing doubt concerning it

46.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever acts righteously does so for himself; and whoever works evil does so against himself. Your Lord is not unjust to the servants

47.Talal Itani (2012): To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour. No fruit emerges from its sheath, and no female conceives or delivers, except with His knowledge. And on the Day when He calls out to them, 'Where are My associates?' They will say, 'We admit to you, none of us is a witness.'

48.Talal Itani (2012): What they used to pray to before will forsake them, and they will realize that they have no escape

49.Talal Itani (2012): The human being never tires of praying for good things; but when adversity afflicts him, he despairs and loses hope

50.Talal Itani (2012): And when We let him taste a mercy from Us, after the adversity that had afflicted him, he will say, 'This is mine, and I do not think that the Hour is coming; and even if I am returned to my Lord, I will have the very best with Him.' We will inform those who disbelieve of what they did, and We will make them taste an awful punishment

51.Talal Itani (2012): When We provide comfort for the human being, he withdraws and distances himself; but when adversity befalls him, he starts lengthy prayers

52.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Have you considered? If it is from God and you reject it—who is further astray than he who is cutoff and alienated?'

53.Talal Itani (2012): We will show them Our proofs on the horizons, and in their very souls, until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is witness over everything

54.Talal Itani (2012): Surely they are in doubt about the encounter with their Lord. Surely He comprehends everything

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): Ayn, Seen, Qaf

3.Talal Itani (2012): Thus He inspires you, and those before you—God the Almighty, the Wise

4.Talal Itani (2012): To him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. He is the Sublime, the Magnificent

5.Talal Itani (2012): The heavens above them almost burst apart, while the angels glorify the praises of their Lord, and ask forgiveness for those on earth. God is indeed the Forgiver, the Merciful

6.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who take masters other than Him: God is in charge of them, and you are not responsible for them

7.Talal Itani (2012): Thus We inspired you with an Arabic Quran, that you may warn the Central City and whoever is around it, and to warn of the Day of Assembly, of which there is no doubt; a group in the Garden, and a group in the Furnace

8.Talal Itani (2012): Had God willed, He could have made them one community, but He admits into His mercy whomever He wills. As for the wrongdoers, they will have no protector and no savior

9.Talal Itani (2012): Or have they adopted protectors besides him? But God is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He has power over all things

10.Talal Itani (2012): Whatever matter you differ about, its judgment rests with God. 'Such is God, my Lord, in Whom I trust, and unto Him I repent.'

11.Talal Itani (2012): Originator of the heavens and the earth. He made for you mates from among yourselves, and pairs of animals, by means of which He multiplies you. There is nothing like Him. He is the Hearing, the Seeing

12.Talal Itani (2012): To Him belongs absolute control of the heavens and the earth. He spreads the bounties to whomever He wills, or reduces it. He is aware of all things

13.Talal Itani (2012): He prescribed for you the same religion He enjoined upon Noah, and what We inspired to you, and what We enjoined upon Abraham, and Moses, and Jesus: 'You shall uphold the religion, and be not divided therein.' As for the idolaters, what you call them to is outrageous to them. God chooses to Himself whom He wills, and He guides to Himself whoever repents

14.Talal Itani (2012): They became divided only after knowledge came to them, out of resentment among themselves. Were it not for a predetermined decision from your Lord, judgment would have been pronounced between them. Indeed, those who were made to inherit the Book after them are in grave doubt about it

15.Talal Itani (2012): To this go on inviting, and be upright as you were commanded, and do not follow their inclinations, and say, 'I believe in whatever Book God has sent down, and I was commanded to judge between you equitably. God is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds, and you have your deeds. Let there be no quarrel between us and you. God will bring us together, and to Him is the ultimate return.'

16.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who dispute about God after having answered His call, their argument is invalid with their Lord; and upon them falls wrath; and a grievous torment awaits them

17.Talal Itani (2012): It is God who revealed the Book with the truth, and the Balance. And what will make you realize that perhaps the Hour is near

18.Talal Itani (2012): Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it; but those who believe are apprehensive of it, and they know it to be the truth. Absolutely, those who question the Hour are in distant error

19.Talal Itani (2012): God is kind towards His worshipers. He provides for whomever He wills. He is the Powerful, the Honorable

20.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We increase for him his harvest; and whoever desires the harvest of this world, We give him thereof, and he has no share of the Hereafter

21.Talal Itani (2012): Or is it that they have partners who litigate for them religious laws never authorized by God? Were it not for the conclusive decision, it would have been settled between them. The wicked will have a painful punishment

22.Talal Itani (2012): You will see the unjust terrified of what they have earned, and it will befall them. As for those who believe and do good deeds, they will be in the Meadows of the Gardens; they will have whatever they please in the presence of their Lord; that is the supreme blessing

23.Talal Itani (2012): That is the good news God gives to His servants who believe and do good deeds. Say, 'I ask of you no wage for it, except affection among the near of kin.' Whoever does a good deed, We will increase its goodness for him. God is Forgiving and Appreciative

24.Talal Itani (2012): Or do they say, 'He forged a lie about God.' If God so willed, He could have sealed your heart. But God obliterates the false, and confirm the true by His Words. He knows what is in the hearts

25.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who accepts the repentance of His worshipers, and remits the sins, and knows what you do

26.Talal Itani (2012): And He answers those who believe and do good deeds, and He increases them of His grace. But the disbelievers will suffer a terrible punishment

27.Talal Itani (2012): If God were to increase the provision to His servants, they would transgress on earth; but He sends down in precise measure whatever He wills. Surely, regarding His servants, He is Expert and Observant

28.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who brings down the rain after they have despaired, and unfolds His mercy. He is the Guardian, the Praised

29.Talal Itani (2012): And of His signs are the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the creatures He has spread throughout them; and He is Able to gather them at will

30.Talal Itani (2012): Whatever misfortune befalls you, it is because of what your hands have earned; and yet He pardons much

31.Talal Itani (2012): You are not the ones to interfere on earth; and besides God, you have no ally, and no helper

32.Talal Itani (2012): And of His signs are the ships sailing the sea like flags

33.Talal Itani (2012): If He willed, He could have stilled the winds, leaving them motionless on its surface. Surely in that are signs for every disciplined, grateful person

34.Talal Itani (2012): Or He could wreck them, because of what they have earned. And yet He pardons much

35.Talal Itani (2012): Those who dispute Our signs know that there is no asylum for them

36.Talal Itani (2012): Whatever thing you are given is only the provision of this life. But what God possesses is better and more lasting for those who believe and rely on their Lord

37.Talal Itani (2012): And those who avoid major sins and indecencies; and if they become angry, they forgive

38.Talal Itani (2012): And those who respond to their Lord, and pray regularly, and conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and give of what We have provided them

39.Talal Itani (2012): And those who, when wronged, defend themselves.

40.Talal Itani (2012): The repayment of a bad action is one equivalent to it. But whoever pardons and makes reconciliation, his reward lies with God. He does not love the unjust

41.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who retaliate after being wronged, there is no blame on them.

42.Talal Itani (2012): Blame lies on those who wrong people, and commit aggression in the land without right. These will have a painful punishment

43.Talal Itani (2012): But whoever endures patiently and forgives—that is a sign of real resolve

44.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever God leaves astray has no protector apart from Him. And you will see the transgressors, when they see the torment, saying, 'Is there a way of going back?'

45.Talal Itani (2012): And you will see them exposed to it, cowering from disgrace, looking with concealed eyes. Those who believed will say, 'The losers are those who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection.' Indeed, the evildoers are in a lasting torment

46.Talal Itani (2012): They will have no allies to support them against God. Whomever God leaves astray has no way out

47.Talal Itani (2012): Respond to your Lord before there comes from God a Day that cannot be turned back. You will have no refuge on that Day, and no possibility of denial

48.Talal Itani (2012): But if they turn away—We did not send you as a guardian over them. Your only duty is communication. Whenever We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but when misfortune befalls them, as a consequence of what their hands have perpetrated, man turns blasphemous

49.Talal Itani (2012): To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates whatever He wills. He grants daughters to whomever He wills, and He grants sons to whomever He wills

50.Talal Itani (2012): Or He combines them together, males and females; and He renders whomever He wills sterile. He is Knowledgeable and Capable

51.Talal Itani (2012): It is not for any human that God should speak to him, except by inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger to reveal by His permission whatever He wills. He is All-High, All-Wise

52.Talal Itani (2012): We thus inspired you spiritually, by Our command. You did not know what the Scripture is, nor what faith is, but We made it a light, with which We guide whomever We will of Our servants. You surely guide to a straight path

53.Talal Itani (2012): The path of God, to whom belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. Indeed, to God all matters revert

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): By the Book that makes things clear

3.Talal Itani (2012): We made it an Arabic Quran, so that you may understand

4.Talal Itani (2012): And it is with Us, in the Source Book, sublime and wise

5.Talal Itani (2012): Shall We hold back the Reminder from you, since you are a transgressing people

6.Talal Itani (2012): How many a prophet did We send to the ancients

7.Talal Itani (2012): No messenger came to them, but they ridiculed him

8.Talal Itani (2012): We destroyed people more powerful than they, and so the example of the ancients has passed away

9.Talal Itani (2012): And if you asked them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' They would say, 'The Mighty, the Knower created them.'

10.Talal Itani (2012): He who made the earth a habitat for you, and traced pathways for you on it, that you may be guided

11.Talal Itani (2012): He who sends down water from the sky in due proportion; and so We revive thereby a dead land. Thus you will be brought out

12.Talal Itani (2012): He Who created all the pairs; and provided you with ships, and animals on which you ride

13.Talal Itani (2012): That you may mount their backs, and remember the favor of your Lord as you sit firmly upon them, and say, 'Glory be to Him Who placed these at our service; surely we could not have done it by ourselves

14.Talal Itani (2012): And surely, to our Lord we will return.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): Yet they turn one of His servants into a part of Him. Man is clearly ungrateful

16.Talal Itani (2012): Or has He chosen for Himself daughters from what He creates, and favored you with sons

17.Talal Itani (2012): Yet when one of them is given news of what he attributes to the Most Gracious, his face darkens, and he suppresses grief

18.Talal Itani (2012): 'Someone brought up to be beautiful, and unable to help in a fight?'

19.Talal Itani (2012): And they appoint the angels, who are servants to the Most Gracious, as females. Have they witnessed their creation? Their claim will be recorded, and they will be questioned

20.Talal Itani (2012): And they say, 'Had the Most Gracious willed, we would not have worshiped them.' But they have no knowledge of that; they are merely guessing

21.Talal Itani (2012): Or have We given them a book prior to this one, to which they adhere

22.Talal Itani (2012): But they say, 'We found our parents on a course, and we are guided in their footsteps.'

23.Talal Itani (2012): Likewise, We sent no warner before you to any town, but the wealthy among them said, 'We found our parents on a course, and we are following in their footsteps.'

24.Talal Itani (2012): He would say, 'Even if I bring you better guidance than what you found your parents following?' They would say, 'We reject what you are sent with.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): So We wreaked vengeance upon them. Behold, then, what was the fate of those who deny

26.Talal Itani (2012): When Abraham said to his father and his people, 'I am innocent of what you worship

27.Talal Itani (2012): Except for He who created me, for He will guide me.'

28.Talal Itani (2012): And he made it an enduring word in his progeny, so that they may return

29.Talal Itani (2012): I gave these and their forefathers some enjoyment, until the truth and a manifest messenger came to them

30.Talal Itani (2012): But when the truth came to them, they said, 'This is sorcery, and we refuse to believe in it.'

31.Talal Itani (2012): They also said, 'If only this Quran was sent down to a man of importance from the two cities.'

32.Talal Itani (2012): Is it they who allocate the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have allocated their livelihood in this life, and We elevated some of them in rank above others, that some of them would take others in service. But your Lord's mercy is better than what they amass

33.Talal Itani (2012): Were it not that humanity would become a single community, We would have provided those who disbelieve in the Most Gracious with roofs of silver to their houses, and stairways by which they ascend

34.Talal Itani (2012): And doors to their houses, and furnishings on which they recline

35.Talal Itani (2012): And decorations. Yet all that is nothing but the stuff of this life. Yet the Hereafter, with your Lord, is for the righteous

36.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever shuns the remembrance of the Most Gracious, We assign for him a devil, to be his companion

37.Talal Itani (2012): They hinder them from the path, though they think they are guided

38.Talal Itani (2012): Until, when He comes to Us, he will say, 'If only there were between me and you the distance of the two Easts.' What an evil companion

39.Talal Itani (2012): It will not benefit you on that Day, since you did wrong. You are partners in the suffering

40.Talal Itani (2012): Can you make the deaf hear, or guide the blind, and him who is in evident error

41.Talal Itani (2012): Even if We take you away, We will wreak vengeance upon them

42.Talal Itani (2012): Or show you what We have promised them; for We have absolute power over them

43.Talal Itani (2012): So adhere to what is revealed to you. You are upon a straight path

44.Talal Itani (2012): It is a message for you, and for your people; and you will be questioned

45.Talal Itani (2012): Ask those of Our messengers We sent before you: 'Did We appoint gods besides the Most Gracious to be worshiped?'

46.Talal Itani (2012): We sent Moses with Our revelations to Pharaoh and his dignitaries. He said, 'I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.'

47.Talal Itani (2012): But when he showed them Our signs, they started laughing at them

48.Talal Itani (2012): Each sign We showed them was more marvelous than its counterpart. And We afflicted them with the plagues, so that they may repent

49.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'O sorcerer, pray to your Lord for us, according to His pledge to you, and then we will be guided.'

50.Talal Itani (2012): But when We lifted the torment from them, they immediately broke their promise

51.Talal Itani (2012): Pharaoh proclaimed among his people, saying, 'O my people, do I not own the Kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flow beneath me? Do you not see

52.Talal Itani (2012): Am I not better than this miserable wretch, who can barely express himself

53.Talal Itani (2012): Why are bracelets of gold not dropped on him, or they angels came with him in procession?'

54.Talal Itani (2012): Thus he fooled his people, and they obeyed him. They were wicked people

55.Talal Itani (2012): And when they provoked Our wrath, We took retribution from them, and We drowned them all

56.Talal Itani (2012): Thus We made them a precedent and an example for the others

57.Talal Itani (2012): And when the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people opposed

58.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'Are our gods better, or he?' They cited him only for argument. In fact, they are a quarrelsome people

59.Talal Itani (2012): He was just a servant whom We blessed, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel

60.Talal Itani (2012): Had We willed, We would have made of you angels to be successors on earth

61.Talal Itani (2012): He is a portent of the Hour, so have no doubt about it, and follow Me. This is a straight way

62.Talal Itani (2012): And let not Satan divert you. He is an open enemy to you

63.Talal Itani (2012): When Jesus came with the clarifications, he said, 'I have come to you with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of what you differ about. So fear God, and obey me

64.Talal Itani (2012): God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him—this is a straight path.'

65.Talal Itani (2012): But the factions differed among themselves. So woe to the wrongdoers from the suffering of a painful Day

66.Talal Itani (2012): Are they only waiting for the Hour to come upon them suddenly, while they are unaware

67.Talal Itani (2012): On that Day, friends will be enemies of one another, except for the righteous

68.Talal Itani (2012): O My servants, you have nothing to fear on that Day, nor will you grieve

69.Talal Itani (2012): Those who believed in Our revelations, and were submissive

70.Talal Itani (2012): Enter the Garden, you and your spouses, Joyfully

71.Talal Itani (2012): They will be served around with trays of gold, and cups. Therein is whatever the souls desire and delights the eyes. Therein you will stay forever

72.Talal Itani (2012): Such is the Garden you are made to inherit, because of what you used to do

73.Talal Itani (2012): Therein you will have abundant fruit, from which you eat

74.Talal Itani (2012): As for the sinners, they will be in the torment of Hell forever

75.Talal Itani (2012): It will never be eased for them. In it, they will be devastated

76.Talal Itani (2012): We did them no injustice, but it was they who were the unjust

77.Talal Itani (2012): And they will cry, 'O Malek, let your Lord finish us off.' He will say, 'You are staying.'

78.Talal Itani (2012): We have given you the truth, but most of you hate the truth

79.Talal Itani (2012): Have they contrived some scheme? We too are contriving

80.Talal Itani (2012): Or do they think that We cannot hear their secrets and their conspiracies? Yes indeed, Our messengers are by them, writing down

81.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'If the Most Gracious had a son, I would be the first to worship.'

82.Talal Itani (2012): Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, beyond what they describe

83.Talal Itani (2012): So leave them to blunder and play, until they encounter their Day which they are promised

84.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who is God in heaven, and God on earth. He is the Wise, the Knower

85.Talal Itani (2012): And blessed is He Who has sovereignty over the heavens and the earth and what is between them. He alone has knowledge of the Hour, and to Him you will be returned

86.Talal Itani (2012): Those they invoke besides Him are incapable of intercession; only those who testify to the truth and have knowledge

87.Talal Itani (2012): And if you asked them, 'Who created them?', they would say, 'God.' Why then do they deviate

88.Talal Itani (2012): As for his statement: 'My Lord, these are a people who do not believe.'

89.Talal Itani (2012): Pardon them, and say, 'Peace.' They will come to know

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): By the Enlightening Scripture

3.Talal Itani (2012): We have revealed it on a Blessed Night—We have warned

4.Talal Itani (2012): In it is distinguished every wise command

5.Talal Itani (2012): A decree from Us. We have been sending messages

6.Talal Itani (2012): As mercy from your Lord. He is the Hearer, the Knower

7.Talal Itani (2012): Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, if you know for sure

8.Talal Itani (2012): There is no god but He. He gives life and causes death—your Lord and Lord of your ancestors of old

9.Talal Itani (2012): Yet they play around in doubt

10.Talal Itani (2012): So watch out for the Day when the sky produces a visible smoke

11.Talal Itani (2012): Enveloping mankind; this is a painful punishment

12.Talal Itani (2012): 'Our Lord, lift the torment from us, we are believers.'

13.Talal Itani (2012): But how can they be reminded? An enlightening messenger has already come to them

14.Talal Itani (2012): But they turned away from him, and said, 'Educated, but crazy!'

15.Talal Itani (2012): We will ease the punishment a little, but you will revert

16.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when We launch the Great Assault—We will avenge

17.Talal Itani (2012): Before them We tested the people of Pharaoh; a noble messenger came to them

18.Talal Itani (2012): Saying, 'Hand over God's servants to me. I am an honest messenger to you.'

19.Talal Itani (2012): And, 'Do not exalt yourselves above God. I come to you with clear authority

20.Talal Itani (2012): I have taken refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me

21.Talal Itani (2012): But if you do not believe in me, keep away from me.'

22.Talal Itani (2012): He appealed to his Lord: 'These are a sinful people.'

23.Talal Itani (2012): 'Set out with My servants by night—you will be followed

24.Talal Itani (2012): And cross the sea quickly; they are an army to be drowned.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind

26.Talal Itani (2012): And plantations, and splendid buildings

27.Talal Itani (2012): And comforts they used to enjoy

28.Talal Itani (2012): So it was; and We passed it on to another people.

29.Talal Itani (2012): Neither heaven nor earth wept over them, nor were they reprieved

30.Talal Itani (2012): And We delivered the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution

31.Talal Itani (2012): From Pharaoh. He was a transgressing tyrant.

32.Talal Itani (2012): And We chose them knowingly over all other people

33.Talal Itani (2012): And We gave them many signs, in which was an obvious test

34.Talal Itani (2012): These people say

35.Talal Itani (2012): 'There is nothing but our first death, and we will not be resurrected

36.Talal Itani (2012): Bring back our ancestors, if you are truthful.'

37.Talal Itani (2012): Are they better, or the people of Tubba and those before them? We annihilated them. They were evildoers

38.Talal Itani (2012): We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them to play

39.Talal Itani (2012): We created them only for a specific purpose, but most of them do not know

40.Talal Itani (2012): The Day of Sorting Out is the appointed time for them all

41.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when no friend will avail a friend in any way, and they will not be helped

42.Talal Itani (2012): Except for him upon whom God has mercy. He is the Mighty, the Merciful

43.Talal Itani (2012): The Tree of Bitterness

44.Talal Itani (2012): The food of the sinner

45.Talal Itani (2012): Like molten lead; boiling inside the bellies

46.Talal Itani (2012): Like the boiling of seething water

47.Talal Itani (2012): Seize him and drag him into the midst of Hell

48.Talal Itani (2012): Then pour over his head the suffering of the Inferno

49.Talal Itani (2012): Taste! You who were powerful and noble

50.Talal Itani (2012): This is what you used to doubt

51.Talal Itani (2012): As for the righteous, they will be in a secure place

52.Talal Itani (2012): Amidst gardens and springs

53.Talal Itani (2012): Dressed in silk and brocade, facing one another

54.Talal Itani (2012): So it is, and We will wed them to lovely companions

55.Talal Itani (2012): They will call therein for every kind of fruit, in peace and security

56.Talal Itani (2012): Therein they will not taste death, beyond the first death; and He will protect them from the torment of Hell

57.Talal Itani (2012): A favor from your Lord. That is the supreme salvation

58.Talal Itani (2012): We made it easy in your language, so that they may remember

59.Talal Itani (2012): So wait and watch. They too are waiting and watching

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): The revelation of the Book is from God, the Exalted in Might, the Wise

3.Talal Itani (2012): In the heavens and the earth are proofs for the believers

4.Talal Itani (2012): And in your own creation, and in the creatures He scattered, are signs for people of firm faith

5.Talal Itani (2012): And in the alternation of night and day, and in the sustenance God sends down from the sky, with which He revives the earth after its death, and in the circulation of the winds, are marvels for people who reason

6.Talal Itani (2012): These are God's Verses which We recite to you in truth. In which message, after God and His revelations, will they believe

7.Talal Itani (2012): Woe to every sinful liar

8.Talal Itani (2012): Who hears God's revelations being recited to him, yet he persists arrogantly, as though he did not hear them. Announce to him a painful punishment

9.Talal Itani (2012): And when he learns something of Our revelations, he takes them in mockery. For such there is a shameful punishment

10.Talal Itani (2012): Beyond them lies Hell. What they have earned will not benefit them at all, nor will those they adopted as lords instead of God. They will have a terrible punishment

11.Talal Itani (2012): This is guidance. Those who blaspheme their Lord's revelations will have a punishment of agonizing pain

12.Talal Itani (2012): It is God who placed the sea at your service, so that ships may run through it by His command, and that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may give thanks.

13.Talal Itani (2012): And He placed at your service whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth—all is from Him. In that are signs for a people who think

14.Talal Itani (2012): Tell those who believe to forgive those who do not hope for the Days of God. He will fully recompense people for whatever they have earned

15.Talal Itani (2012): Whoever does a good deed, it is for his soul; and whoever commits evil, it is against it; then to your Lord you will be returned

16.Talal Itani (2012): We gave the Children of Israel the Book, and wisdom, and prophecy; and We provided them with the good things; and We gave them advantage over all other people

17.Talal Itani (2012): And We gave them precise rulings. They fell into dispute only after knowledge came to them, out of mutual rivalry. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding the things they differed about

18.Talal Itani (2012): Then We set you upon a pathway of faith, so follow it, and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know

19.Talal Itani (2012): They will not help you against God in any way. The wrongdoers are allies of one another, while God is the Protector of the righteous

20.Talal Itani (2012): This is an illumination for mankind, and guidance, and mercy for people who believe with certainty

21.Talal Itani (2012): Do those who perpetrate the evil deeds assume that We will regard them as equal to those who believe and do righteous deeds, whether in their life or their death? Evil is their judgment

22.Talal Itani (2012): God created the heavens and the earth with justice, so that every soul will be repaid for what it has earned. And they will not be wronged

23.Talal Itani (2012): Have you considered him who has taken his desire for his god? God has knowingly led him astray, and has sealed his hearing and his heart, and has placed a veil over his vision. Who will guide him after God? Will you not reflect

24.Talal Itani (2012): And they say, 'There is nothing but this our present life; we die and we live, and nothing destroys us except time.' But they have no knowledge of that; they are only guessing

25.Talal Itani (2012): When Our clarifying Verses are recited to them, their only argument is to say, 'Bring back our ancestors, if you are truthful.'

26.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'God gives you life, then He makes you die; then He gathers you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know.'

27.Talal Itani (2012): To God belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth. On the Day when the Hour takes place, on that Day the falsifiers will lose

28.Talal Itani (2012): You will see every community on its knees; every community will be called to its Book: 'Today you are being repaid for what you used to do

29.Talal Itani (2012): This Book of Ours speaks about you in truth. We have been transcribing what you have been doing.'

30.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the clear triumph

31.Talal Itani (2012): But as for those who disbelieved: 'Were My revelations not recited to you? But you turned arrogant, and were guilty people.'

32.Talal Itani (2012): And when it was said, 'The promise of God is true, and of the Hour there is no doubt,' you said, 'We do not know what the Hour is; we think it is only speculation; we are not convinced.'

33.Talal Itani (2012): The evils of what they did will become evident to them, and the very thing they ridiculed will haunt them

34.Talal Itani (2012): And it will be said, 'Today We forget you, as you forgot the encounter of this Day of yours. Your abode is the Fire, and there are no saviors for you

35.Talal Itani (2012): That is because you took God's revelations for a joke, and the worldly life lured you.' So today they will not be brought out of it, and they will not be allowed to repent

36.Talal Itani (2012): Praise belongs to God; Lord of the heavens, Lord of the earth, Lord of humanity

37.Talal Itani (2012): To Him belongs all supremacy in the heavens and the earth. He is the Majestic, the Wise

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Talal Itani (2012): Ha, Meem

2.Talal Itani (2012): The sending down of the Scripture is from God, the Honorable, the Wise

3.Talal Itani (2012): We did not create the heavens and the earth and what lies between them except with reason, and for a finite period. But the blasphemers continue to ignore the warnings they receive

4.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Have you considered those you worship instead of God? Show me which portion of the earth they have created. Or do they own a share of the heavens? Bring me a scripture prior to this one, or some trace of knowledge, if you are truthful.'

5.Talal Itani (2012): Who is more wrong than him who invokes, besides God, those who will not answer him until the Day of Resurrection, and are heedless of their prayers

6.Talal Itani (2012): And when humanity is gathered, they will be enemies to them, and will renounce their worship of them

7.Talal Itani (2012): When Our revelations are recited to them, plain and clear, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, 'This is obviously magic.'

8.Talal Itani (2012): Or do they say, 'He invented it himself'? Say, 'If I invented it myself, there is nothing you can do to protect me from God. He knows well what you are engaged in. He is sufficient witness between me and you. He is the Forgiver, the Merciful.'

9.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'I am not different from the other messengers; and I do not know what will be done with me, or with you. I only follow what is inspired in me, and I am only a clear warner.'

10.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Have you considered? What if it is from God and you disbelieve in it? A witness from the Children of Israel testified to its like, and has believed, while you turned arrogant. God does not guide the unjust people.'

11.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve say to those who believe, 'If it were anything good, they would not have preceded us to it.' And since they were not guided by it, they will say, 'This is an ancient lie.'

12.Talal Itani (2012): And before it was the Book of Moses, a model and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book, in the Arabic language, to warn those who do wrong—and good news for the doers of good

13.Talal Itani (2012): Those who say, 'Our Lord is God,' then lead a righteous life—they have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve

14.Talal Itani (2012): These are the inhabitants of Paradise, where they will dwell forever—a reward for what they used to do

15.Talal Itani (2012): We have enjoined upon man kindness to his parents. His mother carried him with difficulty, and delivered him with difficulty. His bearing and weaning takes thirty months. Until, when he has attained his maturity, and has reached forty years, he says, 'Lord, enable me to appreciate the blessings You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to act with righteousness, pleasing You. And improve my children for me. I have sincerely repented to You, and I am of those who have surrendered.'

16.Talal Itani (2012): Those are they from whom We accept the best of their deeds, and We overlook their misdeeds, among the dwellers of Paradise—the promise of truth which they are promised

17.Talal Itani (2012): As for him who says to his parents, 'Enough of you! Are you promising me that I will be raised up, when generations have passed away before me?' While they cry for God's help, 'Woe to you! Believe! The promise of God is true!' But he says, 'These are nothing but tales of the ancients.'

18.Talal Itani (2012): Those are they upon whom the sentence is justified, among the communities that have passed away before them, of jinn and humans. They are truly losers

19.Talal Itani (2012): There are degrees for everyone, according to what they have done, and He will repay them for their works in full, and they will not be wronged

20.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when the faithless will be paraded before the Fire: 'You have squandered your good in your worldly life, and you took pleasure in them. So today you are being repaid with the torment of shame, because of your unjust arrogance on earth, and because you used to sin.'

21.Talal Itani (2012): And mention the brother of Aad, as he warned his people at the dunes. Warnings have passed away before him, and after him: 'Worship none but God; I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.'

22.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'Did you come to us to divert us from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are being truthful.'

23.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'The knowledge is only with God, and I inform you of what I was sent with; but I see you are an ignorant people.'

24.Talal Itani (2012): Then, when they saw a cloud approaching their valley, they said, 'This is a cloud that will bring us rain.' 'In fact, it is what you were impatient for: a wind in which is grievous suffering.'

25.Talal Itani (2012): It will destroy everything by the command of its Lord. And when the morning came upon them, there was nothing to be seen except their dwellings. Thus We requite the guilty people

26.Talal Itani (2012): We had empowered them in the same way as We empowered you; and We gave them the hearing, and the sight, and the minds. But neither their hearing, nor their sight, nor their minds availed them in any way. That is because they disregarded the revelations of God; and so they became surrounded by what they used to ridicule

27.Talal Itani (2012): We have destroyed many townships around you, and diversified the signs, so that they may return

28.Talal Itani (2012): Why then did the idols, whom they worshiped as means of nearness to God, not help them? In fact, they abandoned them. It was their lie, a fabrication of their own making

29.Talal Itani (2012): Recall when We dispatched towards you a number of jinn, to listen to the Quran. When they came in its presence, they said, 'Pay attention!' Then, when it was concluded, they rushed to their people, warning them

30.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'O our people, we have heard a Scripture, sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it. It guides to the truth, and to a straight path

31.Talal Itani (2012): O our people! Answer the caller to God, and believe in Him; and He will forgive you your sins, and will save you from a painful punishment.'

32.Talal Itani (2012): He who does not answer the caller to God will not escape on earth, and has no protectors besides Him. Those are in obvious error

33.Talal Itani (2012): Do they not realize that God, who created the heavens and the earth, and was never tired by creating them, is Able to revive the dead? Yes indeed; He is Capable of everything

34.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when those who disbelieved are presented to the Fire: 'Is this not real?' They will say, 'Yes, indeed, by our Lord.' He will say, 'Then taste the suffering for having disbelieved.'

35.Talal Itani (2012): So be patient, as the messengers with resolve were patient, and do not be hasty regarding them. On the Day when they witness what they are promised, it will seem as if they had lasted only for an hour of a day. A proclamation: Will any be destroyed except the sinful people

1.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve and repel from the path of God—He nullifies their works

2.Talal Itani (2012): While those who believe, and work righteousness, and believe in what was sent down to Muhammad—and it is the truth from their Lord—He remits their sins, and relieves their concerns

3.Talal Itani (2012): That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehoods, while those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. God thus cites for the people their examples

4.Talal Itani (2012): When you encounter those who disbelieve, strike at their necks. Then, when you have routed them, bind them firmly. Then, either release them by grace, or by ransom, until war lays down its burdens. Had God willed, He could have defeated them Himself, but He thus tests some of you by means of others. As for those who are killed in the way of God, He will not let their deeds go to waste

5.Talal Itani (2012): He will guide them, and will improve their state of mind

6.Talal Itani (2012): And will admit them into Paradise, which He has identified for them

7.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! If you support God, He will support you, and will strengthen your foothold

8.Talal Itani (2012): But as for those who disbelieve, for them is perdition, and He will waste their deeds

9.Talal Itani (2012): That is because they hated what God revealed, so He nullified their deeds

10.Talal Itani (2012): Have they not journeyed through the earth and seen the consequences for those before them? God poured destruction upon them, and for the unbelievers is something comparable

11.Talal Itani (2012): That is because God is the Master of those who believe, while the disbelievers have no master

12.Talal Itani (2012): God will admit those who believe and do good deeds into gardens beneath which rivers flow. As for those who disbelieve, they enjoy themselves, and eat as cattle eat, and the Fire will be their dwelling

13.Talal Itani (2012): How many a town was more powerful than your town which evicted you? We destroyed them, and there was no helper for them

14.Talal Itani (2012): Is he who stands upon evidence from his Lord, like someone whose evil deed is made to appear good to him? And they follow their own desires

15.Talal Itani (2012): The likeness of the Garden promised to the righteous: in it are rivers of pure water, and rivers of milk forever fresh, and rivers of wine delightful to the drinkers, and rivers of strained honey. And therein they will have of every fruit, and forgiveness from their Lord. Like one abiding in the Fire forever, and are given to drink boiling water, that cuts-up their bowels

16.Talal Itani (2012): Among them are those who listen to you, but when they leave your presence, they say to those given knowledge, 'What did he say just now?' Those are they whose hearts God has sealed, and they follow their own desires

17.Talal Itani (2012): As for those who are guided, He increases them in guidance, and He has granted them their righteousness

18.Talal Itani (2012): Are they just waiting until the Hour comes to them suddenly? Its tokens have already come. But how will they be reminded when it has come to them

19.Talal Itani (2012): Know that there is no god but God, and ask forgiveness for your sin, and for the believing men and believing women. God knows your movements, and your resting-place

20.Talal Itani (2012): Those who believe say, 'If only a chapter is sent down.' Yet when a decisive chapter is sent down, and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those in whose hearts is sickness looking at you with the look of someone fainting at death. So woe to them

21.Talal Itani (2012): Obedience and upright speech. Then, when the matter is settled, being true to God would have been better for them

22.Talal Itani (2012): If you turn away, you are likely to make mischief on earth, and sever your family ties

23.Talal Itani (2012): Those are they whom God has cursed. He made them deaf, and blinded their sight

24.Talal Itani (2012): Will they not ponder the Quran? Or are there locks upon their hearts

25.Talal Itani (2012): Those who reverted after the guidance became clear to them—Satan has enticed them, and has given them latitude.

26.Talal Itani (2012): That is because they said to those who hated what God has revealed, 'We will obey you in certain matters.' But God knows their secret thoughts

27.Talal Itani (2012): How about when the angels take them at death, beating their faces and their backs

28.Talal Itani (2012): That is because they pursued what displeases God, and they disliked His approval, so He nullified their works

29.Talal Itani (2012): Do those in whose hearts is sickness think that God will not expose their malice

30.Talal Itani (2012): Had We willed, We could have shown them to you, and you would have recognized them by their marks. Yet you will recognize them by their tone of speech. And God knows your actions

31.Talal Itani (2012): We will certainly test you, until We know those among you who strive, and those who are steadfast, and We will test your reactions

32.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve, and hinder from the path of God, and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them—they will not hurt God in the least, but He will nullify their deeds

33.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! obey God, and obey the Messenger, and do not let your deeds go to waste

34.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieve, and hinder from God's path, and then die as disbelievers—God will not forgive them

35.Talal Itani (2012): So do not waver and call for peace while you have the upper hand. God is with you, and He will not waste your efforts

36.Talal Itani (2012): The life of this word is nothing but play and pastime. But if you have faith and lead a righteous life, He will grant you your rewards, and He will not ask you for your possessions

37.Talal Itani (2012): Were He to ask you for it, and press you, you would become tightfisted, and He would expose your unwillingness

38.Talal Itani (2012): Here you are, being called to spend in the cause of God. Among you are those who withhold; but whoever withholds is withholding against his own soul. God is the Rich, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people, and they will not be like you

1.Talal Itani (2012): We have granted you a conspicuous victory

2.Talal Itani (2012): That God may forgive you your sin, past and to come, and complete His favors upon you, and guide you in a straight path

3.Talal Itani (2012): And help you with an unwavering support

4.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers, to add faith to their faith. To God belong the forces of the heavens and the earth. God is Knowing and Wise

5.Talal Itani (2012): He will admit the believers, male and female, into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever, and He will remit their sins. That, with God, is a great triumph.

6.Talal Itani (2012): And He will punish the hypocrites, male and female, and the idolaters, male and female, those who harbor evil thoughts about God. They are surrounded by evil; and God is angry with them, and has cursed them, and has prepared for them Hell—a miserable destination

7.Talal Itani (2012): To God belong the troops of the heavens and the earth. God is Mighty and Wise

8.Talal Itani (2012): We sent you as a witness, and a bearer of good news, and a warner

9.Talal Itani (2012): That you may believe in God and His Messenger, and support Him, and honor Him, and praise Him morning and evening

10.Talal Itani (2012): Those who pledge allegiance to you are pledging allegiance to God. The hand of God is over their hands. Whoever breaks his pledge breaks it to his own loss. And whoever fulfills his covenant with God, He will grant him a great reward

11.Talal Itani (2012): The Desert-Arabs who remained behind will say to you, 'Our belongings and our families have preoccupied us, so ask forgiveness for us.' They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, 'Who can avail you anything against God, if He desires loss for you, or desires gain for you?' In fact, God is Informed of what you do

12.Talal Itani (2012): But you thought that the Messenger and the believers will never return to their families, and this seemed fine to your hearts; and you harbored evil thoughts, and were uncivilized people

13.Talal Itani (2012): He who does not believe in God and His Messenger—We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blazing Fire

14.Talal Itani (2012): To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whomever He wills, and He punishes whomever He wills. God is Forgiving and Merciful

15.Talal Itani (2012): Those who lagged behind will say when you depart to collect the gains, 'Let us follow you.' They want to change the Word of God. Say, 'You will not follow us; God has said so before.' Then they will say, 'But you are jealous of us.' In fact, they understand only a little

16.Talal Itani (2012): Say to the Desert-Arabs who lagged behind, 'You will be called against a people of great might; you will fight them, unless they submit. If you obey, God will give you a fine reward. But if you turn away, as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment.'

17.Talal Itani (2012): There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick. Whoever obeys God and His Messenger—He will admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away—He will punish him with a painful punishment

18.Talal Itani (2012): God was pleased with the believers, when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, and sent down serenity upon them, and rewarded them with an imminent conquest

19.Talal Itani (2012): And abundant gains for them to capture. God is Mighty and Wise

20.Talal Itani (2012): God has promised you abundant gains, which you will capture. He has expedited this for you, and has restrained people's hands from you; that it may be a sign to the believers, and that He may guide you on a straight path

21.Talal Itani (2012): And other things, of which you were incapable, but God has encompassed them. God is Capable of everything

22.Talal Itani (2012): If those who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned back and fled, then found neither protector nor helper

23.Talal Itani (2012): It is God's pattern, ongoing since the past. You will never find any change in God's pattern

24.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who withheld their hands from you, and your hands from them, in the valley of Mecca, after giving you advantage over them. God is Observer of what you do

25.Talal Itani (2012): It is they who disbelieved, and barred you from the Sacred Mosque, and prevented the offering from reaching its destination. Were it not for faithful men and faithful women, whom you did not know, you were about to hurt them, and became guilty of an unintentional crime. Thus God admits into His mercy whomever He wills. Had they dispersed, We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful penalty

26.Talal Itani (2012): Those who disbelieved filled their hearts with rage—the rage of the days of ignorance. But God sent His serenity down upon His Messenger, and upon the believers, and imposed on them the words of righteousness—of which they were most worthy and deserving. God is aware of everything

27.Talal Itani (2012): God has fulfilled His Messenger's vision in truth: 'You will enter the Sacred Mosque, God willing, in security, heads shaven, or hair cut short, not fearing. He knew what you did not know, and has granted besides that an imminent victory.'

28.Talal Itani (2012): It is He who sent His Messenger with the guidance and the religion of truth, to make it prevail over all religions. God suffices as Witness

29.Talal Itani (2012): Muhammad is the Messenger of God. Those with him are stern against the disbelievers, yet compassionate amongst themselves. You see them kneeling, prostrating, seeking blessings from God and approval. Their marks are on their faces from the effects of prostration. Such is their description in the Torah, and their description in the Gospel: like a plant that sprouts, becomes strong, grows thick, and rests on its stem, impressing the farmers. Through them He enrages the disbelievers. God has promised those among them who believe and do good deeds forgiveness and a great reward

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! Do not place your opinions above that of God and His Messenger, and fear God. God is Hearing and Knowing

2.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and do not speak loudly to him, as you speak loudly to one another, lest your works be in vain without you realizing

3.Talal Itani (2012): Those who lower their voices before God's Messenger—those are they whose hearts God has tested for piety. They will have forgiveness and a great reward

4.Talal Itani (2012): Those who call you from behind the chambers—most of them do not understand

5.Talal Itani (2012): Had they remained patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But God is Forgiving and Merciful

6.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! If a troublemaker brings you any news, investigate, lest you harm people out of ignorance, and you become regretful for what you have done

7.Talal Itani (2012): And know that among you is the Messenger of God. Had he obeyed you in many things, you would have suffered hardship. But God has given you the love of faith, and adorned it in your hearts, and made disbelief, mischief, and rebellion hateful to you. These are the rightly guided

8.Talal Itani (2012): A Grace and Favor from God. God is Knowing and Wise

9.Talal Itani (2012): If two groups of believers fight each other, reconcile between them. But if one group aggresses against the other, fight the aggressing group until it complies with God's command. Once it has complied, reconcile between them with justice, and be equitable. God loves the equitable

10.Talal Itani (2012): The believers are brothers, so reconcile between your brothers, and remain conscious of God, so that you may receive mercy

11.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! No people shall ridicule other people, for they may be better than they. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than they. Nor shall you slander one another, nor shall you insult one another with names. Evil is the return to wickedness after having attained faith. Whoever does not repent—these are the wrongdoers

12.Talal Itani (2012): O you who believe! Avoid most suspicion—some suspicion is sinful. And do not spy on one another, nor backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would detest it. So remain mindful of God. God is Most Relenting, Most Merciful

13.Talal Itani (2012): O people! We created you from a male and a female, and made you races and tribes, that you may know one another. The best among you in the sight of God is the most righteous. God is All-Knowing, Well-Experienced

14.Talal Itani (2012): The Desert-Arabs say, 'We have believed.' Say, 'You have not believed; but say, 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered into your hearts. But if you obey God and His Messenger, He will not diminish any of your deeds. God is Forgiving and Merciful.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger, and then have not doubted, and strive for God's cause with their wealth and their persons. These are the sincere

16.Talal Itani (2012): Say, 'Are you going to teach God about your religion, when God knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and God is aware of all things?'

17.Talal Itani (2012): They regarded it a favor to you that they have submitted. Say, 'Do not consider your submission a favor to me; it is God who has done you a favor by guiding you to the faith, if you are sincere.'

18.Talal Itani (2012): God knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and God is seeing of everything you do

1.Talal Itani (2012): Qaf. By the Glorious Quran

2.Talal Itani (2012): They marveled that a warner has come to them from among them. The disbelievers say, 'This is something strange

3.Talal Itani (2012): When we have died and become dust? This is a farfetched return.'

4.Talal Itani (2012): We know what the earth consumes of them, and with Us is a comprehensive book

5.Talal Itani (2012): But they denied the truth when it has come to them, so they are in a confused state

6.Talal Itani (2012): Have they not observed the sky above them, how We constructed it, and decorated it, and it has no cracks

7.Talal Itani (2012): And the earth, how We spread it out, and set on it mountains, and grew in it all kinds of delightful pairs

8.Talal Itani (2012): A lesson and a reminder for every penitent worshiper

9.Talal Itani (2012): And We brought down from the sky blessed water, and produced with it gardens and grain to harvest

10.Talal Itani (2012): And the soaring palm trees, with clustered dates

11.Talal Itani (2012): As sustenance for the servants. And We revive thereby a dead town. Likewise is the resurrection

12.Talal Itani (2012): Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, and so did the dwellers of Russ, and Thamood

13.Talal Itani (2012): And Aad, and Pharaoh, and the brethren of Lot

14.Talal Itani (2012): And the Dwellers of the Woods, and the people of Tubba. They all rejected the messengers, so My threat came true

15.Talal Itani (2012): Were We fatigued by the first creation? But they are in doubt of a new creation

16.Talal Itani (2012): We created the human being, and We know what his soul whispers to him. We are nearer to him than his jugular vein

17.Talal Itani (2012): As the two receivers receive, seated to the right and to the left

18.Talal Itani (2012): Not a word does he utter, but there is a watcher by him, ready

19.Talal Itani (2012): The daze of death has come in truth: 'This is what you tried to evade.'

20.Talal Itani (2012): And the Trumpet is blown: 'This is the Promised Day.'

21.Talal Itani (2012): And every soul will come forward, accompanied by a driver and a witness

22.Talal Itani (2012): 'You were in neglect of this, so We lifted your screen from you, and your vision today is keen.'

23.Talal Itani (2012): And His escort will say, 'This is what I have ready with me.'

24.Talal Itani (2012): 'Throw into Hell every stubborn disbeliever

25.Talal Itani (2012): Preventer of good, aggressor, doubter

26.Talal Itani (2012): Who fabricated another god with God; toss him into the intense agony.'

27.Talal Itani (2012): His escort will say, 'Our Lord, I did not make him rebel, but he was far astray.'

28.Talal Itani (2012): He will say, 'Do not feud in My presence—I had warned you in advance

29.Talal Itani (2012): The decree from Me will not be changed, and I am not unjust to the servants.'

30.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when We will say to Hell, 'Are you full?' And it will say, 'Are there any more?'

31.Talal Itani (2012): And Paradise will be brought closer to the pious, not far away

32.Talal Itani (2012): 'This is what you were promised—for every careful penitent

33.Talal Itani (2012): Who inwardly feared the Most Gracious, and came with a repentant heart

34.Talal Itani (2012): Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity.'

35.Talal Itani (2012): Therein they will have whatever they desire—and We have even more

36.Talal Itani (2012): How many generations before them, who were more powerful than they, did We destroy? They explored the lands—was there any escape

37.Talal Itani (2012): In that is a reminder for whoever possesses a heart, or cares to listen and witness

38.Talal Itani (2012): We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days, and no fatigue touched Us

39.Talal Itani (2012): So endure what they say, and proclaim the praises of your Lord before the rising of the sun, and before sunset

40.Talal Itani (2012): And glorify Him during the night, and at the end of devotions

41.Talal Itani (2012): And listen for the Day when the caller calls from a nearby place

42.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when they will hear the Shout in all truth. That is the Day of Emergence

43.Talal Itani (2012): It is We who control life and death, and to Us is the destination

44.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when the earth will crack for them at once. That is an easy gathering for Us

45.Talal Itani (2012): We are fully aware of what they say, and you are not a dictator over them. So remind by the Quran whoever fears My warning

1.Talal Itani (2012): By the spreaders spreading

2.Talal Itani (2012): And those carrying loads

3.Talal Itani (2012): And those moving gently

4.Talal Itani (2012): And those distributing as commanded

5.Talal Itani (2012): What you are promised is true

6.Talal Itani (2012): Judgment will take place

7.Talal Itani (2012): By the sky that is woven

8.Talal Itani (2012): You differ in what you say

9.Talal Itani (2012): Averted from it is he who is averted

10.Talal Itani (2012): Perish the imposters

11.Talal Itani (2012): Those who are dazed in ignorance

12.Talal Itani (2012): They ask, 'When is the Day of Judgment?'

13.Talal Itani (2012): The Day they are presented to the Fire

14.Talal Itani (2012): 'Taste your ordeal. This is what you used to challenge.'

15.Talal Itani (2012): But the pious are amidst gardens and springs

16.Talal Itani (2012): Receiving what their Lord has given them. They were virtuous before that

17.Talal Itani (2012): They used to sleep a little at night

18.Talal Itani (2012): And at dawn, they would pray for pardon

19.Talal Itani (2012): And in their wealth, there was a share for the beggar and the deprived

20.Talal Itani (2012): And on earth are signs for the convinced

21.Talal Itani (2012): And within yourselves. Do you not see

22.Talal Itani (2012): And in the heaven is your livelihood, and what you are promised

23.Talal Itani (2012): By the Lord of the heaven and the earth, it is as true as the fact that you speak

24.Talal Itani (2012): Has the story of Abraham's honorable guests reached you

25.Talal Itani (2012): When they entered upon him, they said, 'Peace.' He said, 'Peace, strangers.'

26.Talal Itani (2012): Then he slipped away to his family, and brought a fatted calf

27.Talal Itani (2012): He set it before them. He said, 'Will you not eat?'

28.Talal Itani (2012): And he harbored fear of them. They said, 'Do not fear,' and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy

29.Talal Itani (2012): His wife came forward crying. She clasped her face, and said, 'A barren old woman?'

30.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'Thus spoke your Lord. He is the Wise, the Knowing.'

31.Talal Itani (2012): He said, 'What is your business, O envoys?'

32.Talal Itani (2012): They said, 'We are sent to a people guilty of sin.'

33.Talal Itani (2012): 'To unleash upon them rocks of clay.'

34.Talal Itani (2012): 'Marked by your Lord for the excessive.'

35.Talal Itani (2012): We evacuated all the believers who were in it

36.Talal Itani (2012): But found in it only one household of Muslims

37.Talal Itani (2012): And We left in it a sign for those who fear the painful punishment

38.Talal Itani (2012): And in Moses. We sent him to Pharaoh with a clear authority

39.Talal Itani (2012): But he turned away with his warlords, and said, 'A sorcerer or a madman.'

40.Talal Itani (2012): So We seized him and his troops, and threw them into the sea, and He was to blame

41.Talal Itani (2012): And in Aad. We unleashed against them the devastating wind

42.Talal Itani (2012): It spared nothing it came upon, but rendered it like decayed ruins

43.Talal Itani (2012): And in Thamood. They were told, 'Enjoy yourselves for a while.'

44.Talal Itani (2012): But they defied the command of their Lord, so the lightning struck them as they looked on

45.Talal Itani (2012): They could not rise up, nor could they find help

46.Talal Itani (2012): And before that, the people of Noah. They were immoral people

47.Talal Itani (2012): We constructed the universe with power, and We are expanding it

48.Talal Itani (2012): And the earth—We spread it out—How well We prepared it

49.Talal Itani (2012): We created all things in pairs, so that you may reflect and ponder

50.Talal Itani (2012): 'So flee towards God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.'

51.Talal Itani (2012): 'And do not set up any other god with God. I am to you from Him a clear warner.'

52.Talal Itani (2012): Likewise, no messenger came to those before them, but they said, 'A sorcerer or a madman.'

53.Talal Itani (2012): Did they recommend it to one another? In fact, they are rebellious people

54.Talal Itani (2012): So turn away from them; you are not to blame

55.Talal Itani (2012): And remind, for the reminder benefits the believers

56.Talal Itani (2012): I did not create the jinn and the humans except to worship Me

57.Talal Itani (2012): I need no livelihood from them, nor do I need them to feed Me

58.Talal Itani (2012): God is the Provider, the One with Power, the Strong

59.Talal Itani (2012): Those who do wrong will have their turn, like the turn of their counterparts, so let them not rush Me

60.Talal Itani (2012): So woe to those who disbelieve because of that Day of theirs which they are promised

1.Talal Itani (2012): By the Mount

2.Talal Itani (2012): And a Book inscribed

3.Talal Itani (2012): In a published scroll

4.Talal Itani (2012): And the frequented House

5.Talal Itani (2012): And the elevated roof

6.Talal Itani (2012): And the seething sea

7.Talal Itani (2012): The punishment of your Lord is coming

8.Talal Itani (2012): There is nothing to avert it

9.Talal Itani (2012): On the Day when the heaven sways in agitation

10.Talal Itani (2012): And the mountains go into motion

11.Talal Itani (2012): Woe on that Day to the deniers

12.Talal Itani (2012): Those who play with speculation

13.Talal Itani (2012): The Day when they are shoved into the Fire of Hell forcefully

14.Talal Itani (2012): 'This is the Fire which you used to deny

15.Talal Itani (2012): Is this magic, or do you not see
